analyzed: nīhāraḥ roga bhayam bhūkampaḥ pravara nṛpa mṛtyum  ulkāḥ mantri vināśam nānā varṇāḥ ghanāḥ ca bhayam atulam
translated: Dew causes fear of disease, an earthquake the death of an excellent king.🔽A meteor causes the destruction of ministers, and clouds of various colors cause incomparable fear.

original: stanitaṃ garbhavināśaṃ vidyunnṛpadaṃṣṭriparipīḍām//🔽pariveṣo rukpīḍāṃ digdāho nṛpabhayaṃ ca saagnibhayaṃ/🔽rūkṣo vāyuḥ prabalaś caurasamutthaṃ bhayaṃ dhatte//
analyzed: stanitam garbha vināśam vidyut nṛpa daṃṣṭri paripīḍām  pariveṣaḥ ruj pīḍām digdāhaḥ nṛpa bhayam ca sa agni bhayam  rūkṣaḥ vāyuḥ prabalaḥ caura samuttham bhayam dhatte
translated: Thunder causes the destruction of embryos, lightning the oppression of kings and beasts of prey.🔽A halo causes pain, and a conflagration in the directions causes fear of kings and fire.🔽A rough and strong wind causes fear arising from thieves.

original: nirghātaḥ suracāpaṃ daṇḍaś ca kṣudbhayaṃ saparacakram/
analyzed: nirghātaḥ sura cāpam daṇḍaḥ ca kṣudh bhayam sa para cakram
translated: A whirlwind, a rainbow, and a rod cause fear of famine and foreign invasion.

original: grahayuddheK /grahayuddhaṃ nṛpayuddhaṃ ketuś ca tad eva sandṛṣṭaḥ//
analyzed: graha yuddha ikgraha yuddham nṛpa yuddham ketuḥ ca tat eva san dṛṣṭaḥ
translated: A battle of planets, a battle of kings, and a banner seen in the same way cause the same [fear].

analyzed: avikṛta salila nipātaiḥknipāte sapta aha antar subhikṣam ādeśyam
translated: If there is a fall of water without any change, within seven days, an abundance of food should be predicted.

original: yac caaśubhaṃ grahaṇajaṃ tat sarvaṃ nāśan upayāti//
analyzed: yat ca aśubham grahaṇa jam tat sarvam na aśan upayāti
translated: And whatever inauspiciousness arises from an eclipse, all that is destroyed.

original: somagrahe nivṛtte pakṣānte yadi bhaved graho arkasya/
analyzed: soma grahe nivṛtte pakṣa ante yadi bhavet grahaḥ arkasya
translated: If there is an eclipse of the moon at the end of the fortnight after the lunar eclipse is over,

analyzed: tatra anayaḥ prajānām dampatyoḥ vairam anyonyam
translated: then there is destruction of people and mutual enmity between husband and wife.

original: arkagrahāt tu śaśino grahaṇaṃ yadi dṛśyate tato viprāḥ/
analyzed: arka grahāt tu śaśinaḥ grahaṇam yadi dṛśyate tatas viprāḥ
translated: But if the eclipse of the moon is seen after the eclipse of the sun, then the brahmins,

analyzed: na eka kratu phala bhājaḥ bhavanti muditāḥ prajāḥ ca eva
translated: the people enjoy the fruits of a single sacrifice and the people are delighted.

analyzed: bhaumacāra adhyāyaḥ
translated: Chapter on the Motion of Mars

analyzed: yadi udaya ṛkṣāt vakram karoti navama aṣṭa saptama ṛkṣeṣu
translated: If it makes a retrograde motion from the rising constellation in the ninth, eighth or seventh constellation,

original: tadvaktrāmK /vakram ū /vaktram uṣṇam udaye pīḍākaram agnivārttānām//
analyzed: tad vaktrām kvakram uṣṇam udaye pīḍā karam agni vārttānām
translated: that is a mouth-retrograde, a mouth-upward, a hot retrograde, causing affliction at rising to those born under the sign of Aries.

analyzed: dvādaśa daśama ekādaśa nakṣatrāt vakrite kuje aśru mukham
translated: When Mars makes a retrograde motion from the twelfth, tenth or eleventh constellation, it is a tear-faced [retrograde].

original: dūṣayati rasān udaye karoti rogān avṛṣṭiṃ ca//
analyzed: dūṣayati rasān udaye karoti rogān avṛṣṭim ca
translated: It contaminates the juices, causes diseases at rising, and also drought.

original: vyālaṃ trayodaśaṛkṣāc caturdaśād vā vipacyate astamaye/
analyzed: vyālam trayodaśa ṛkṣāt caturdaśāt vā vipacyate astamaye
translated: It is a fierce [retrograde] from the thirteenth or fourteenth constellation, when it sets.

analyzed: daṃṣṭri vyāla mṛgebhyaḥ karoti pīḍām subhikṣam ca
translated: It causes affliction from carnivorous beasts, reptiles, deer and elephants, and also plenty.

original: rudhiraānanam iti vaktraṃ pañcadaśāt ṣoḍaśāc ca vinivṛtte/
analyzed: rudhira ānanam iti vaktram pañcadaśāt ṣoḍaśāt ca vinivṛtte
translated: The mouth called Rudhiranana [is seen] when it turns back from the fifteenth or sixteenth [constellation].

original: tatkālaṃ mukharogaṃ sabhayaṃ ca subhikṣam āvahati//
analyzed: tad kālam mukha rogam sa bhayam ca subhikṣam āvahati
translated: At that time it brings about mouth diseases, danger, and plenty.

original: asimuśalaṃ saptadaśād aṣṭādaśato api vā tad anuvakre/🔽dasyugaṇebhyaḥ pīdāṃ karoty avṛṣṭiṃ saśastrabhayām//
analyzed: asi muśalam saptadaśāt aṣṭādaśataḥ api vā tat anuvakre  dasyu gaṇebhyaḥ pīdām karoti avṛṣṭim sa śastra bhayām
translated: The sword and mace [are inauspicious] from the seventeenth to the eighteenth [sign], or it may be in the following [sign].🔽It causes affliction from hordes of thieves, drought, and fear of weapons.

analyzed: yadi nivartate vaiśvadaivate bhaumaḥ
translated: If Mars turns back when it has risen in the Bhagya or Āryaman [sign], or if it is in the Vaiśvadevī [sign] when the sun has set,

original: prājāpatye astamitas trīn api lokān nipīḍayati//
analyzed: prājāpatye astamitaḥ trīn api lokān nipīḍayati
translated: it afflicts all three worlds when it is in the Prājāpatya [sign].

analyzed: śravaṇa oditasya vakram puṣye mūrdha abhiṣikta pīḍā kṛt
translated: The retrograde motion of [Mars] when it has risen in the Śravaṇa [sign] causes affliction to the head and consecration in the Puṣya [sign].

original: yasminn ṛkṣe abhyuditas taddigvyūhān janān hanti//
analyzed: yasmin ṛkṣe abhyuditaḥ tad diś vyūhān janān hanti
translated: In whatever lunar mansion it rises, it kills people who are arrayed in that direction.

original: madhyena yadi maghānāṃ gataagataṃ lohitaḥ karoti tataḥ/
analyzed: madhyena yadi maghānām gata agatam lohitaḥ karoti tatas
translated: If Mars moves back and forth between the Magha [lunar mansions], then

original: pāṇḍyo nṛpo vinaśyati śastraudyogād bhayam avṛṣṭiṃ//🔽bhittvā maghāK /maghāṃ viśākhāṃ bhindan bhaumaḥ karoti durbhikṣam/
analyzed: pāṇḍyaḥ nṛpaḥ vinaśyati śastra audyogāt bhayam avṛṣṭim  bhittvā viśākhām bhindan bhaumaḥ karoti durbhikṣam
translated: the king of Pāṇḍya perishes, there is danger from the use of weapons, and drought.🔽Mars, having entered the Magha [lunar mansion], breaks through the Magha and Viśākhā [lunar mansions], causing famine.

original: marakaṃ karoti ghoraṃ yadi bhittvā rohiṇīṃ yāti//
analyzed: marakam karoti ghoram yadi bhittvā rohiṇīm yāti
translated: If it moves on, having broken through Rohiṇī, it causes a terrible epidemic.

analyzed: dakṣiṇatas rohiṇyāḥ caran mahījaḥ argha vṛṣṭi nigraha kṛt
translated: Moving to the south of Rohiṇī, Mars causes a rise in prices and a cessation of rain.

analyzed: dhūmāyan sa śikhaḥ vā vinihanyāt pāriyātra sthān
translated: If it smokes with flames, it would destroy the inhabitants of Pāriyātra.

original: prājāpatye śravaṇe mūle triṣu cauttareṣuK /tisṛṣūttarāsu śākre ca/
analyzed: prājāpatye śravaṇe mūle triṣu ca auttareṣu ktisṛṣu uttarāsu śākre ca
translated: In the three northern ones, i.e., Śravaṇa, Dhaniṣṭhā, and Śatabhiṣā, and in the three Uttaras, i.e., Uttarāṣāḍhā, Uttaraproṣṭhapadī, and Uttarabhādrapadā, and in Śakra's, i.e., Revatī.

analyzed: vicaran ghana nivahānām upaghāta karaḥ kṣamā tanayaḥ
translated: Wandering, the son of the earth, causing harm to the masses of clouds.

analyzed: cāra audayāḥ praśastāḥ
translated: The ascendant movements are praised in Śravaṇa, Maghā, Āditya, Hasta, and Mūla. In Mūla and Hasta.

analyzed: ekapadā aśvi viśākhā prājāpatyeṣu ca kujasya  vipula vimala mūrtiḥ kiṃśuka aśoka varṇaḥ
translated: And in the single-footed, Aśvinī, Viśākhā, and Prajāpatya, of Mars.🔽Having a vast and pure form, the color of kiṃśuka and aśoka flowers,

analyzed: sphuṭa rucira mayūkhaḥ tapta tāmra prabhā ābhaḥ
translated: With clear and beautiful rays, shining with the luster of heated copper,

analyzed: vicarati yadi mārgam ca auttaram medinī jaḥ
translated: If the son of the earth wanders in the northern path,

analyzed: śubha kṛt avanipānām hārdi daḥ ca prajānām
translated: He brings good fortune to the waters of the earth and gives joy to the people.

analyzed: budhacārādhyāyaḥ
translated: The Chapter on the Movements of Mercury

original: nautpātaparityaktaḥ kadā cid api candrajo vrajaty udayam/
analyzed: na autpāta parityaktaḥ kadā cid api candrajaḥ vrajati udayam
translated: The son of the moon never rises abandoned by the inauspicious planets.

analyzed: jala dahana pavana bhaya kṛt dhānya argha kṣaya vivṛddhau vā
translated: He brings fear from water, fire, and wind, and increases the price of grain.

analyzed: vicaran
translated: Wandering in Śravaṇa, Dhaniṣṭhā, and Prajāpatya,

analyzed: mṛdnan himakaratanayaḥ karoti avṛṣṭim sa roga bhayām
translated: Crushing, the son of the moon brings drought and fear of disease.

analyzed: raudra ādīni maghā antāni upāśrite candra je prajā pīḍā
translated: When the moon occupies the signs from Aries to Magha, there is affliction to the people.

analyzed: śastra nipāta kṣudh bhaya roga anāvṛṣṭi santāpaiḥ
translated: By weapons, famine, fear, disease, drought, and heat.

original: hastaādīni caranK /vicaran ṣaḍṛkṣāṇy upapīḍayan gavām aśubhaḥ/
analyzed: hasta ādīni caran kvicaran ṣaṣ ṛkṣāṇi upapīḍayan gavām aśubhaḥ
translated: When the moon moves through the six signs beginning with Hasta, afflicting them, it is inauspicious for cows.

original: sneharasaarghavivṛddhiṃ karoti caurvīṃ prabhūtaannām//🔽āryamṇaṃ hautabhujaṃ bhadrapadām uttrarāṃ yameśaṃ ca/
analyzed: sneha rasa argha vivṛddhim karoti caurvīm prabhūta annām  ā aryamṇam hautabhujam bhadrapadām uttrarām yama īśam ca
translated: It brings an increase in affection, wealth, and plenty of food.🔽If the moon's son [the sun] afflicts Āryaman, Agni, the two Bhadrapadas, Uttarā, and Yama's [Saviṣṭa],

analyzed: candrasya sutaḥ nighnan prāṇabhṛtām dhātu saṃkṣaya kṛt
translated: he destroys the elements of living beings.

analyzed: āśvina vāruṇa mūlāni upamṛdnan revatīm ca candra sutaḥ
translated: If the moon's son [the sun] afflicts the three signs beginning with Āśleṣā, Revatī,

analyzed: paṇya bhiṣaj naujīvika salilaja turaga aupaghāta karaḥ
translated: he causes harm to trade, physicians, fire, livelihood, water, and horses.

analyzed: pūrva ādi ṛkṣa tritayāt ekam api indoḥ sutaḥ abhimṛdnīyāt
translated: If the moon's son [the sun] afflicts even one of the three signs beginning with Āśleṣā,

analyzed: kṣudh śastra taskara āmaya bhaya pradāyī caran jagataḥ  prākṛta vimiśra saṃkṣipta tīkṣṇa yogānta ghora pāpa ākhyāḥ
translated: moving through the world, he gives fear of hunger, weapons, thieves, and disease.

analyzed: sapta parāśara tantre nakṣatraiḥ kīrtitāḥ gatayaḥ
translated: The seven courses are declared in the Parāśara Tantra, called ordinary, mixed, contracted, sharp, joined, terrible, and sinful.

analyzed: prākṛta saṃjñāḥ vāyavya yāmi apaitāmahāni bahulāḥ ca
translated: The ordinary ones are called Vāyavya, Yāmya, and Paitāmaha, and the abundant ones.

analyzed: miśrā gatiḥ pradiṣṭā
translated: The mixed motion is declared to be that of the moon, the sun, the ancestors, the serpents, and the gods.

analyzed: saṃkṣiptāyām puṣyaḥ punarvasuḥ phalgunī dvayam ca eti
translated: In the contracted motion, Pushya, Punarvasu, and the two Phalgunis are included.

analyzed: tīkṣṇāyām bhadrapadā dvayam sa śākra aśvayuj pauṣṇam
translated: In the sharp motion, the two Bhadrapadas, the two Ashvayujas with Shakra, and Pushya are included.

original: yogāntikāiti mūlaṃ dve caāṣāḍhe gatiḥ sutasyaindoḥ//
analyzed: yoga antikā iti mūlam dve ca āṣāḍhe gatiḥ sutasya aindoḥ
translated: In the Yoga motion, Mula, the two Ashadhas, and the motion of the moon's son are included.

original: ghorā śravaṇas tvāṣṭraṃ vasudaivaṃK /vasudevaṃ vāruṇaṃ caeva//
analyzed: ghorā śravaṇaḥ tvāṣṭram vasudaivam kvasudevam vāruṇam ca eva
translated: The terrible motion includes Shravana, the Vasu deity, and the Varuna deity.

analyzed: pāpa ākhyā sāvitram maitram śakra agni daivatam ca eti
translated: The sinful motion includes Savitra, Maitra, and the Shakra and Agni deities.

original: udayapravāsadivasaiḥ sa eva gatilakṣaṇaṃ prāha//🔽dvisametā viṃśatir
analyzed: udaya pravāsa divasaiḥ saḥ eva gati lakṣaṇam prāha  dvi sametā
translated: He himself has stated the characteristics of the motion based on the days of rising and departure.🔽Twenty with two added,

analyzed: ca
translated: and twenty-nine with two,

analyzed: daśa
translated: and ten with one added,

analyzed: prākṛta ādyānām
translated: are for the natural and other motions.

analyzed: prākṛta gatyām ārogya vṛṣṭi sasya pravṛddhayaḥ kṣemam
translated: In the natural motion, there is health, rain, abundant crops, and prosperity.

analyzed: saṃkṣipta miśrayoḥ miśram etat anyāsu viparītam
translated: In the contracted and mixed motions, there is a mixture of these, and the opposite in the other motions.

analyzed: ṛjvī ativakrā avakrā vikalā ca matena devalasya etāḥ
translated: According to Devala's opinion, these are straight, very crooked, crooked, and defective.

analyzed: pañca catur dvi ekāhāḥ ṛjvī ādīnām ṣaṭ abhyastāḥ
translated: The six multiplied by five, four, two, and one are the days of the straight and other motions.

original: ṛjvī hitā prajānām ativakrā arghaṃK /ativakrārthaṃ gatir vināśayati/
analyzed: ṛjvī hitā prajānām ati vakrā arghaṃkati vakrā artham gatiḥ vināśayati
translated: For a straight [planet] is beneficial for the people, a very crooked [one] is harmful. A very crooked motion destroys [the country].

analyzed: śastra bhaya dā ca vakrā vikalā bhaya roga saṃjananī
translated: And a crooked [planet] gives fear from weapons, a defective [one] generates fear and disease.

analyzed: pauṣa āṣāḍha śrāvaṇa vaiśākheṣu indu jaḥ sa māgheṣu
translated: The Moon is in the months of Pauṣa, Āṣāḍha, Śrāvaṇa, and Vaiśākha, which are the months of the Sun.

original: vṛṣṭo bhayāya jagataḥ śubhaphalakṛt proṣitas teṣu//
analyzed: vṛṣṭaḥ bhayāya jagataḥ śubha phala kṛt proṣitaḥ teṣu
translated: If it rains in those months, it is for the fear of the world; if it is absent in those months, it produces auspicious results.

original: kārtikeK /kārttike aśvayuji vā yadi māse dṛśyate tanubhavaḥ śiśirāṃśoḥ/
translated: If the Moon's body is seen in the month of Kārttika or Āśvayuja,

analyzed: śastra caura hutabhuj gada toya kṣudh bhayāni ca tadā vidadhāti
translated: then it brings about the fears of weapons, thieves, fire, famine, and hunger.

original: ruddhāni saumye astagateK /astamite purāṇi yāny udgate tāny upayānti mokṣam/
analyzed: ruddhāni saumye asta gata ikastamite purāṇi yāni udgate tāni upayānti mokṣam
translated: When the Moon is in the west, the cities that are besieged are released; when it has set, the cities that have set are released; when it has risen, those cities attain liberation.

original: anye tu paścād udite vadanti lābhaḥ purāṇāṃ bhavati tajjñāḥ//
analyzed: anye tu paścāt udite vadanti lābhaḥ purāṇām bhavati tad jñāḥ
translated: But others say that when it has risen in the west, the wise know that it is the gain of the old cities.

original: hemakāntir atha vā śukavarṇaḥ sasyakena maṇinā sadṛśo vā/
analyzed: hema kāntiḥ atha vā śuka varṇaḥ sasyakena maṇinā sadṛśaḥ vā
translated: If the Moon has the luster of gold, or the color of a parrot, or resembles a gem of barley,

original: snigdhamūrtir alaghuś ca hitāya vyatyaye na śubhakṛt śaśiputraḥ//
analyzed: snigdha mūrtiḥ alaghuḥ ca hitāya vyatyaye na śubha kṛt śaśiputraḥ
translated: with a smooth body and not light, it is for the benefit [of the country]; if the reverse, the Moon does not bring auspicious results.

analyzed: bṛhaspati cāra adhyāyaḥ
translated: The Chapter on the Motions of Jupiter

analyzed: nakṣatreṇa saha audayam upagacchati yena devapati mantrī
translated: By which [planet] the preceptor of the lord of gods attains conjunction with a lunar mansion,

analyzed: tad saṃjñam vaktavyam varṣam māsa krameṇa eva
translated: That year should be named according to the order of the months.

analyzed: varṣāṇi kārttika ādīni āgneyāt bha dvaya anuyogīni
translated: The years beginning with Kārttika are to be combined with the two sets of eight beginning with Agni.

original: kramaśas tribhaṃ tu pañcamam upāntyam antyaṃ ca yad varṣam//
analyzed: kramaśas tribham tu pañcamam upāntyam antyam ca yat varṣam
translated: The third, fifth, penultimate and last years are to be combined with the three sets of five.

analyzed: śakaṭa anala aupajīvaka gopīḍā vyādhi śastra kopaḥ ca
translated: Carts, fires, dependence on others, oppression of cows, diseases, weapons and anger,

analyzed: vṛddhiḥ tu rakta pītaka kusumānām kārttike varṣe
translated: and increase of red and yellow flowers in the year of Kārttika.

original: saumye abde anāvṛṣṭir mṛgaākhuśalabhaaṇḍajaiś ca sasyavadhaḥ/
analyzed: saumye abde anāvṛṣṭiḥ mṛga ākhu śalabha aṇḍajaiḥ ca sasya vadhaḥ
translated: In the year of Soma, there is drought, and crops are destroyed by deer, rats, locusts and oviparous insects.

original: vyādhibhayaṃ mitrair api bhūpānāṃ jāyate vairam//
analyzed: vyādhi bhayam mitraiḥ api bhūpānām jāyate vairam
translated: There is danger of disease, and kings become hostile even to their friends.

analyzed: śubha kṛt jagataḥ pauṣaḥ nivṛtta vairāḥ parasparam kṣitipāḥ
translated: Pauṣa is auspicious for the world. Kings cease hostilities with each other.

analyzed: dvi triguṇaḥ dhānya arghaḥ pauṣṭika karma prasiddhiḥ ca
translated: The price of grain is two or three times higher, and auspicious rites are successful.

analyzed: pitṛ pūjā parivṛddhiḥ māghe hārdiḥ ca sarva bhūtānām
translated: In Māgha, there is increase in worship of ancestors and in the hearts of all beings.

analyzed: ārogya vṛṣṭi dhānya argha sampadaḥ mitra lābhaḥ ca
translated: There is health, rain, plenty of grain, wealth and gain of friends.

original: phālgunavarṣe vindyāt kva cit kva cit kṣemavṛṣṭisasyāni/
analyzed: phālguna varṣe vindyāt kva cit kva cit kṣema vṛṣṭi sasyāni
translated: In the year of Phālguna, one should know that there will be peace, rain and crops in some places and not in others.

original: daurbhāgyaṃ pramadānāṃ prabalāś caurā nṛpāś caugrāḥ//
analyzed: daurbhāgyam pramadānām prabalāḥ caurāḥ nṛpāḥ ca augrāḥ
translated: Women are unfortunate, thieves are powerful, and kings are harsh.

original: caitre mandā vṛṣṭiḥ priyam annaṃ kṣemam avanipā mṛdavaḥ/
analyzed: caitre mandā vṛṣṭiḥ priyam annam kṣemam avanipāḥ mṛdavaḥ
translated: In Chaitra, the rain is scanty, food is dear, the earth is prosperous, the people are mild,

original: vṛddhiś ca kośadhānyasya bhavati pīḍā ca rūpavatām//
analyzed: vṛddhiḥ ca kośa dhānyasya bhavati pīḍā ca rūpavatām
translated: and there is an increase in the treasury and grain, but affliction to the beautiful ones.

original: vaiśākhe dharmaratāK /dharmaparā vigatabhayāḥ pramuditāḥ prajāḥ sanṛpāḥ/
analyzed: vaiśākhe dharma ratāḥ ak dharma parāḥ vigata bhayāḥ pramuditāḥ prajāḥ sa nṛpāḥ
translated: In Vaishakha, the people are devoted to dharma, free from fear, delighted, and the kings are also so.

analyzed: yajña kriyā prāvṛttiḥ niṣpattiḥ sarva sasyānām
translated: There is an increase in sacrificial rites and the completion of all crops.

analyzed: jyaiṣṭhe jāti kula dhana śreṇī śreṣṭhāḥ nṛpāḥ sa dharma jñāḥ
translated: In Jyeshtha, the kings are foremost in caste, family, wealth, and lineage, and know dharma.

original: pīḍyante dhānyāni ca hitvā kaṅguṃ śamījātim//🔽āṣāḍhe jāyante sasyāni kva cid avṛṣṭir anyatra/
analyzed: pīḍyante dhānyāni ca hitvā kaṅgum śamī jātim  āṣāḍhe jāyante sasyāni kva cit avṛṣṭiḥ anyatra
translated: The grains are afflicted, leaving only kanghu and shami grains.🔽In Ashadha, crops are produced in some places, but there is drought in others.

original: yogakṣemaṃ madhyaṃ vyagrāś ca bhavanti bhūpālāḥ//
analyzed: yogakṣemam madhyam vyagrāḥ ca bhavanti bhūpālāḥ
translated: The kings are indifferent, and their welfare is in the middle.

original: śrāvaṇavarṣe kṣemaṃ samyak sasyāni pākam upayānti/
analyzed: śrāvaṇa varṣe kṣemam samyak sasyāni pākam upayānti
translated: In the monsoon of Shravana, there is prosperity and the crops ripen well.

original: kṣudrā ye pākhaṇḍāḥK /pāṣaṇḍāḥ pīḍyante ye ca tadbhaktāḥ//
analyzed: kṣudrāḥ ye pākhaṇḍa aṅkpāṣaṇḍāḥ pīḍyante ye ca tad bhaktāḥ
translated: The minor heretics and those who worship them are afflicted.

original: bhādrapade vallījaṃ niṣpattiṃ yāti pūrvasasyaṃ ca/
analyzed: bhādrapade vallījam niṣpattim yāti pūrva sasyam ca
translated: In Bhadrapada, the creeper-born crops and the previous crops are completed.

original: na bhavaty aparaṃ sasyaṃ kva cit subhikṣaṃ kvacic ca bhayam//
analyzed: na bhavati aparam sasyam kva cit subhikṣam kvacid ca bhayam
translated: The later crops are not produced everywhere, and there is plenty in some places and fear in others.

original: āśvayuje abde ajasraṃ patati jalaṃ pramuditāḥ prajāḥ kṣemam/
analyzed: āśvayuje abde ajasram patati jalam pramuditāḥ prajāḥ kṣemam
translated: In the year Ashvayuj, rain falls continuously, the people are delighted, and there is peace.

analyzed: prāṇa cayaḥ prāṇabhṛtām sarveṣām anna bāhulyam
translated: There is an abundance of food for all living beings.

original: udagārogyasubhikṣakṣemakaro vākpatiś caran bhānām/🔽yāmye tadviparīto madhyena tu madhyaphaladāyī//🔽vicaran bhadvayam iṣṭas tatsārdhaṃ vatsareṇa madhyaphalaḥ/
analyzed: udak ārogya subhikṣa kṣema karaḥ vākpatiḥ caran bhānām                    vicaran bha dvayam iṣṭaḥ tad sārdham vatsareṇa madhya phalaḥ
translated: If Jupiter moves in the north, it brings health, prosperity, and peace.🔽If in the south, it brings the opposite. If in the middle, it gives moderate results.🔽If it moves in both directions, it is auspicious. With that, the results are moderate in a year.

original: sasyānāṃ vidhvaṃsī vicared adhikaṃ yadi kadā cit//🔽analabhayam analavarṇe vyādhiḥ pīte raṇaāgamaḥ śyāme/
analyzed: sasyānām vidhvaṃsī vicaret adhikam yadi kadā cit  anala bhayam anala varṇe vyādhiḥ pīte raṇa āgamaḥ śyāme
translated: If it moves more than that, it destroys crops.🔽If the planet is smoky, there is danger from fire. If yellow, there is disease. If dark, there is war.

original: harite ca taskarebhyaḥ pīḍā rakte tu śastrabhayam//🔽dhūmaābhe anāvṛṣṭis tridaśagurau nṛpavadho divā dṛṣṭe/
analyzed: harite ca taskarebhyaḥ pīḍā rakte tu śastra bhayam  dhūma ābhe anāvṛṣṭiḥ tridaśa gurau nṛpa vadhaḥ divā dṛṣṭe
translated: If green, there is trouble from thieves. If red, there is danger from weapons.🔽If seen during the day in the smoke-colored planet, there is drought. If seen at night, there is danger to the king.

original: vipule amale sutāre rātrau dṛṣṭe prajāḥ svasthāḥ//🔽rohiṇyo analabhaṃ ca vatsaratanur nābhis tv aṣāḍhadvayaṃ
analyzed: vipule amale sutāre rātrau dṛṣṭe prajāḥ svasthāḥ  rohiṇyaḥ analabham ca vatsaratanuḥ nābhiḥ tu aṣāḍha dvayam
translated: If the star is large, clear, and good, the people are healthy.

original: sārpaṃ hṛtpitṛdaivataṃ ca kusumaṃ śuddhaiḥ śubhaṃ taiḥ phalam/
analyzed: sārpam hṛd pitṛ daivatam ca kusumam śuddhaiḥ śubham taiḥ phalam
translated: The Rohini, Anala, and Vatsara stars are good for the body. The two Ashadha stars are good for the heart, ancestors, and gods. The Kusuma star is good with pure and auspicious results.

original: dehe krūranipīḍite agnyanilajaṃ nābhyāṃ bhayaṃ kṣutkṛtaṃ
analyzed: dehe krūra nipīḍite agni anila jam nābhyām bhayam kṣudh kṛtam
translated: If the body is afflicted by cruel [forces], there is danger from fire and wind in the navel, caused by hunger.

original: puṣpe mūlaphalakṣayo atha hṛdaye sasyasya nāśo dhruvam//
analyzed: puṣpe mūla phala kṣayaḥ atha hṛdaye sasyasya nāśaḥ dhruvam
translated: If in the flower, there is destruction of roots and fruits; if in the heart, there is certain destruction of crops.

analyzed: gatāni varṣāṇi śaka indra kālāt
translated: The years that have passed since the time of Shakra Indra,

analyzed: dhatāni rudraiḥ guṇayet caturbhiḥ
translated: should be multiplied by four and subtracted by the Rudras.

analyzed: yutāni kṛtvā  yuktam śaka bhūpa kālam
translated: Having added them,

analyzed: saṃśodhya ṣaṣṭyā viṣayaiḥ vibhajya
translated: the remaining years should be subtracted by the result obtained, and the time of Shakra's reign should be subtracted by sixty and divided by the signs.

analyzed: yugāni nārāyaṇa pūrvakāṇi
translated: The yugas beginning with Narayana,

analyzed: labdhāni śeṣāḥ kramaśas samāḥ syuḥ
translated: the remaining years should be equal in order.

original: ekaikam abdeṣu navaāhateṣu dattvā pṛthag dvādaśakaṃ krameṇa/
analyzed: ekaikam abdeṣu nava āhateṣu dattvā pṛthak dvādaśakam krameṇa
translated: Having given one each in the newly completed years, twelve separately in order,

original: hṛtvā caturbhir vasudevatāādyāny uḍūni śeṣāṃśakapūrvam abdam//
analyzed: hṛtvā caturbhiḥ vasudevatā ādyāni uḍūni śeṣa aṃśaka pūrvam abdam
translated: and having subtracted by four, the lunar mansions beginning with Vasudeva, the remaining part is the year.

original: viṣṇuḥ surejyo balabhid dhutāśas tvaṣṭauttaraproṣṭhapadāadhipaś ca/
analyzed: viṣṇuḥ surejyaḥ balabhid hutāśaḥ tvaṣṭā auttaraproṣṭhapada adhipaḥ ca
translated: Vishnu, the sun, the slayer of Bala, the fire, and the lord of the northern Ashva-Bhadrapada,

analyzed: kramāt yuga īśāḥ pitṛ viśva soma ksomāḥ śakra anala ākhya aśvi bhagāḥ pradiṣṭāḥ
translated: are declared to be the lords of the yugas in order, and the Pitris, Visvas, Soma, Soma, Shakra, Agni, Ashvins, and Bharga.

original: saṃvatsaro agniḥ parivatsaro arka idāādikaḥ śītamayūkhamālī/
analyzed: saṃvatsaraḥ agniḥ parivatsaraḥ arkaḥ idāādikaḥ śīta mayūkha mālī
translated: The year is Agni, the second year is Arka, the third year is Ida, and the fourth year is the moon-decked Shiva.

original: prajāpatiś caapy anuvatsaraḥ syād idvatsaraḥ śailasutāpatiś ca//
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ ca api anuvatsaraḥ syāt idvatsaraḥ śailasutā patiḥ ca
translated: The year of Prajapati is also like this, and the year of the lord of the mountain's daughter (Shiva) is like this.

original: vṛṣṭiḥ samādye pramukhe dvitīye prabhūtatoyā kathitā tṛtīye/
analyzed: vṛṣṭiḥ sama ādye pramukhe dvitīye prabhūta toyā kathitā tṛtīye
translated: In the first year, rain is said to be at the beginning, in the second, abundant water is said in the third.

original: paścāj jalaṃ muñcati yac caturthaṃ svalpaudakaṃ pañcamam abdam uktam//
analyzed: paścāt jalam muñcati yat caturtham su alpa audakam pañcamam abdam uktam
translated: The fourth year releases water from the west, and the fifth year is said to have little water.

analyzed: catvāri mukhyāni yugāni atha eṣām viṣṇu indrajīva anala daivatāni
translated: The first four are the principal yugas, and they have Vishnu, Indra, Jiva, and Agni as their presiding deities.

original: catvāri madhyāni ca madhyamāni catvāri caantyāny adhamāni
analyzed: catvāri madhyāni ca madhyamāni catvāri ca antyāni adhamāni
translated: The four middle ones are the middle ones, and the four last ones are the lowest.

analyzed: vindyāt
translated: One should know.

original: ādyaṃ dhaniṣṭāṃśam abhiprapanno māghe yadā yāty udayaṃ surejyaḥ/
analyzed: ādyam dhaniṣṭha aṃśam abhiprapannaḥ māghe yadā yāti udayam surejyaḥ
translated: When the sun enters the part of Dhanishtha in Magha, and rises,

original: ṣaṣṭyabdapūrvaḥ prabhavaḥ sa nāmnā prapadyateK /pravartate bhūtahitas tadābdaḥ//
analyzed: ṣaṣṭi abda pūrvaḥ prabhavaḥ sa nāmnā bhūta hitaḥ tadā abdaḥ
translated: then that year, which is sixty years prior, begins, and is called Pravritti, and then the year for the welfare of beings begins.

original: kva cit tv avṛṣṭiḥ pavanaagnikopaḥ santiītayaḥ śleṣmakṛtāś ca rogāḥ/
analyzed: kva cit tu avṛṣṭiḥ pavana agni kopaḥ santi ītayaḥ śleṣma kṛtāḥ ca rogāḥ
translated: Somewhere there is drought, anger of wind and fire, there are calamities, and diseases caused by phlegm.

original: saṃvatsare asmin prabhave pravṛtte na duḥkham āpnoti janas tathāapi//
analyzed: saṃvatsare asmin prabhave pravṛtte na duḥkham āpnoti janaḥ tathā api
translated: In this year when Pravritti begins, people do not suffer any misery.

original: tasmād dvitīyo vibhavaḥ pradiṣṭaḥ śuklas tṛtīyaḥ parataḥ pramodaḥ/
analyzed: tasmāt dvitīyaḥ vibhavaḥ pradiṣṭaḥ śuklaḥ tṛtīyaḥ paratas pramodaḥ
translated: Therefore, the second is declared to be Vibhava, the third is Shukla, and after that is Pramoda.

original: prajāpatiś caiti yathottarāṇi śastāni varṣāṇi phalāny athaeṣāmK /caiṣām//
analyzed: prajāpatiḥ ca eti yathā uttarāṇi śastāni varṣāṇi phalāni atha eṣām kca eṣām
translated: And Prajapati, the subsequent years are praised as fruitful for them.

analyzed: niṣpanna śāli ikṣu yava ādi sasyām bhayaiḥ vimuktām upaśānta vairām
translated: Free from the fear of crops like fully ripened rice, sugarcane, barley, etc., with conflicts pacified,

original: saṃhṛṣṭalokāṃ kalidoṣamuktāṃ kṣatraṃ tadā śāsti ca bhūtadhātrīm//
analyzed: saṃhṛṣṭa lokām kali doṣa muktām kṣatram tadā śāsti ca bhūtadhātrīm
translated: With the people delighted, free from the faults of Kali, the Kshatriya then rules the earth, the sustainer of beings.

original: ādyo aṅgirāḥ śrīmukhabhāvasāāhvau yuvā sudhātetiK /yuvātha dhāteti yuge dvitīye/
analyzed: ādyaḥ aṅgirāḥ yuvā dhātā iti yuge dvitīye
translated: In the first yuga, Angiras, in the second, Sudhata, in the third, Dhata, in the fourth, Vrisha - thus the four yugas are named after these four sages.

original: varṣāṇi pañcaeva yathākrameṇa trīṇy atra śastāni same pare dve//
analyzed: varṣāṇi pañca eva yathākrameṇa trīṇi atra śastāni same pare dve
translated: For five years each, in order, three are praised here, the other two are equal.

analyzed: triṣu ādya varṣa iṣu kaṅgira ādyeṣu
translated: In the first three years, in the years of Angiras and others,

original: K's tr / ādyavarṣeṣu nikāmavarṣī devī nirātaṅkabhayaśK /bhayāś ca lokaḥ/
analyzed: ādya varṣeṣu nikāma varṣī devī ca lokaḥ
translated: In the first three years, the goddess rains as much as desired, and the people are free from fear and anxiety.

original: abdadvaye antye api samā suvṛṣṭiḥ kintv atra rogāḥ samaraāgamaś ca//
analyzed: abda dvaye antye api samā su vṛṣṭiḥ kintu atra rogāḥ samara āgamaḥ ca
translated: In the last two years also, the rainfall is good, but here there are diseases and the onset of war.

original: śākre yuge pūrvam athaīśvaraākhyaṃ varṣaṃ dvitīyaṃ bahudhānyam āhuḥ/
analyzed: śākre yuge pūrvam atha īśvara ākhyam varṣam dvitīyam bahudhānyam āhuḥ
translated: In Shakra's yuga, the first year is named Ishvara, the second year is said to have plenty of grain.

original: pramāthinaṃ vikramam apy athaanyadK /ato anyad vṛṣaṃ ca vindyād gurucārayogāt//
analyzed: pramāthinam vikramam api atha anyad kataḥ anyat vṛṣam ca vindyāt guru cāra yogāt
translated: Then Pramathin, Vikrama, and another, one should know another as Vrisha, by the yoga of the movement of the preceptor.

original: ādyaṃ dvitīyaṃ ca śubhe tu varṣe kṛtaanukāraṃ kurutaḥ prajānām/
analyzed: ādyam dvitīyam ca śubhe tu varṣe kṛta anukāram kurutaḥ prajānām
translated: The first and second years in a good year, they imitate the people's actions.

original: pāpaḥ pramāthī vṛṣavikramau tu subhikṣadau rogabhayapradau ca//
analyzed: pāpaḥ pramāthī vṛṣa vikramau tu subhikṣa dau roga bhaya pradau ca
translated: The evil, the destroyer, and the two with the strength of a bull, they give good harvests but also cause fear of disease.

original: śreṣṭhaṃ ca caturthasya yugasya pūrvaṃ yac citrabhānuṃ kathayanti varṣam/
analyzed: śreṣṭham ca caturthasya yugasya pūrvam yat citrabhānum kathayanti varṣam
translated: The best is the first of the fourth yuga, which they call the Citrabhānu year.

original: madhyaṃ dvitīyaṃ tu subhānusañjñaṃ rogapradaṃ mṛtyukaraṃ na taṃ caK /na tac ca//🔽tāraṇaṃ tadanu bhūrivāridaṃ sasyavṛddhimuditātiK /muditaṃ capārthivam/
analyzed: madhyam dvitīyam tu subhānu sañjñam roga pradam mṛtyu karam na tam tat ca  tāraṇam tadanu bhūri vāri dam sasya vṛddhi mudita atikmuditam ca pārthivam
translated: The second is the middle one, called Subhānu, which gives disease and causes death, but not that.🔽Then comes Tāraṇa, which gives plenty of rain, increases crops, and delights the people and kings.

original: pañcamaṃ vyayam uśanti śobhanaṃ manmathaprabalam utsavaākulam//
analyzed: pañcamam vyayam uśanti śobhanam manmatha prabalam utsava ākulam
translated: The fifth is said to be auspicious, powerful in love, and full of festivities.

original: tvāṣṭre yuge sarvajidādya uktaḥ saṃvatsaro anyaḥ khalu sarvadhārī/
analyzed: tvāṣṭre yuge sarva jit ādyaḥ uktaḥ saṃvatsaraḥ anyaḥ khalu sarva dhārī
translated: In the Tvaṣṭri yuga, the first year is said to be Sarvajit, and another is Sarvadhārī.

original: tasmād virodhī vikṛtaḥ kharaś ca śasto dvitīyo atra bhayāya śeṣāḥ//
analyzed: tasmāt virodhī vikṛtaḥ kharaḥ ca śastaḥ dvitīyaḥ atra bhayāya śeṣāḥ
translated: From that, Virodhī, Vikṛta, and Khara are praised, and the second is for fear, the rest are not.

original: nandano atha vijayo jayas tathā manmatho asya parataś ca durmukhaḥ/
analyzed: nandanaḥ atha vijayaḥ jayaḥ tathā manmathaḥ asya paratas ca durmukhaḥ
translated: Then come Nandana, Vijaya, Jaya, and Manmatha, and after that, Durmukha.

original: kāntam atra yuga āditas trayaṃ manmathaḥ samaphalo adhamo aparaḥ//
analyzed: kāntam atra yuge āditas trayam manmathaḥ sama phalaḥ adhamaḥ aparaḥ
translated: Of these, the first three yugas are good, and Manmatha is of equal results, the last one is inferior.

original: hemalamba iti saptame yuge syād vilambi parato vikāri ca/🔽śarvarīti tadanu plavaḥ smṛto vatsaro guruvaśena pañcamaḥ//
analyzed: hema lambaḥ iti saptame yuge syāt vilambi paratas vikāri ca  śarvarī iti tadanu plavaḥ smṛtaḥ vatsaraḥ guru vaśena pañcamaḥ
translated: In the seventh yuga, it would be Hemalamb, then Vilambi, and then Vikari.🔽Then Sharvari is remembered, followed by Plava, the fifth year, according to the Guru's influence.

original: ītiprāyāK /itiprāyaḥ pracurapavanā vṛṣṭir abde tu pūrve
analyzed: pracura pavanā vṛṣṭiḥ abde tu pūrve
translated: In the first year, there is plenty of wind and rain,

original: mandaṃ sasyaṃ na bahusalilaṃ vatsare ato dvitīye/
analyzed: mandam sasyam na bahu salilam vatsare atas dvitīye
translated: in the second year, crops are slow and there is not much water.

original: atyudvegaḥ pracurasalilaḥ syāt tṛtīyaś caturtho🔽durbhikṣāya plava iti tataḥ śobhano bhūritoyaḥ//
analyzed: atyudvegaḥ pracura salilaḥ syāt tṛtīyaḥ  durbhikṣāya plavaḥ iti tatas śobhanaḥ bhūri toyaḥ
translated: The third and fourth years would be very distressing and full of water,🔽and the fifth year is for famine. Then the sixth year is good and full of water.

original: vaiśve yuge śokahṛdK /śobhakṛd ity athaādyaḥ saṃvatsaro ataḥ śubhakṛd dvitīyaḥ/
analyzed: vaiśve yuge śoka hṛd śobha kṛt iti atha ādyaḥ saṃvatsaraḥ atas śubha kṛt dvitīyaḥ
translated: In the Vaishnava yuga, the first year brings sorrow to the heart and is inauspicious, the second year is auspicious.

original: krodhī tṛtīyaḥ parataḥ krameṇa viśvāvasuś caiti parābhavaś ca//
analyzed: krodhī tṛtīyaḥ paratas krameṇa viśvāvasuḥ ca eti parābhavaḥ ca
translated: The third is angry, and the fourth is Vishvavasu and Parabhava in order.

original: pūrvāparau prītikarau prajānām eṣāṃ tṛtīyo bahudoṣado abdaḥ/
analyzed: pūrva aparau prīti karau prajānām eṣām tṛtīyaḥ bahu doṣa daḥ abdaḥ
translated: The first two years bring joy to the people, the third year has many faults.

original: antyau samau kintu parābhave agniḥ śastraāmayaārtir dvijagobhayaṃ ca//
analyzed: antyau samau kintu parābhave agniḥ śastra āmaya ārtiḥ dvija go bhayam ca
translated: The last two are equal, but in Parabhava, there is fire, weapons, disease, and both Brahmins and cows.

original: ādyaḥ plavaṅgo navame yuge abdaḥ syāt kīlako anyaḥ parataś ca saumyaḥ/
analyzed: ādyaḥ plavaṅgaḥ navame yuge abdaḥ syāt kīlakaḥ anyaḥ paratas ca saumyaḥ
translated: The first year in the ninth yuga is Plavanga, the next is Kilikila, and the one after that is auspicious.

original: sādhāraṇo rodhakṛd ity athaevaṃK /athābdaḥ śubhapradau kīlakasaumyasaṃjñau//
analyzed: sādhāraṇaḥ rodha kṛt iti atha evaṃkathā abdaḥ śubha pradau kīlaka saumya saṃjñau
translated: The common one is called Rodhakṛt, and the one like that is called Atha. The one that gives good is called Kīlaka and Saumya.

original: kaṣṭaḥ plavaṅgo bahuśaḥ prajānāṃ sādhāraṇe alpaṃ jalam ītayaś ca/
analyzed: kaṣṭaḥ plavaṅgaḥ bahuśas prajānām sādhāraṇe alpam jalam ītayaḥ ca
translated: The difficult one is called Plavanga, which brings much suffering to the people. In the common one, there is little water and calamities.

original: yaḥ pañcamo rodhakṛd ity athaabdaś citram jalam tatra ca sasyasampat//
analyzed: yaḥ pañcamaḥ rodha kṛt iti atha abdaḥ citram jalam tatra ca sasya sampad
translated: The fifth one is called Rodhakṛt, and the year like that brings variegated water, and there is abundance of crops.

original: indrāgnidaivaṃ daśamaṃ yugaṃ yat tatraādyavarṣaṃK /tarādyamabdaṃ paridhāvisaṃjñam/
analyzed: indra agni daivam daśamam yugam yat paridha avi saṃjñam
translated: The tenth yuga, which is under the lordship of Indra and Agni, the first year of that is called K.tarādyam, and the year like that is called Pari-dhāvin.

original: pramādinaṃ vikramam apy ato anyatK /pramādyathānandamataḥ paraṃ yat syād rākṣasaṃ caanalasaṃjñitam ca//
analyzed: pramādinam vikramam api atas param yat syāt rākṣasam ca anala saṃjñitam ca
translated: The one after that is called Vikrama, which is also heedless. The one after that which is called Rākṣasa and Anala is full of heedlessness and joy.

original: paridhāvini madhyadeśanāśo nṛpahānir jalam alpam agnikopaḥ/🔽alasas tu janaḥ pramādisaṃjñe ḍamaraṃ raktakapuṣpabījanāśaḥ//🔽vikramaḥK /tatparaḥ sakalalokanandano rākṣasaḥ kṣayakaro analas tathā/
analyzed: paridhāvini madhyadeśa nāśaḥ nṛpa hāniḥ jalam alpam agni kopaḥ  alasaḥ tu janaḥ pramādi saṃjñe ḍamaram raktaka puṣpa bīja nāśaḥ  sakala loka nandanaḥ rākṣasaḥ kṣaya karaḥ analaḥ tathā
translated: In Pari-dhāvin, there is destruction of the middle country, loss of kings, little water, and anger of fire.🔽In Pra-mādi, people are lazy, and there is destruction of Dmara, red flowers, and seeds.🔽In Vikrama, people are devoted to that, and it brings joy to all people. Rākṣasa brings destruction, and Anala brings anger of fire and gifts of gems.

analyzed: grīṣma dhānya jananaḥ atra rākṣasaḥ vahni kopa maraka pradaḥ analaḥ
translated: In this, Rākṣasa brings forth summer crops, and Anala brings forth anger of fire and gifts of gems.

analyzed: ekādaśe piṅgala kāla yukta siddhārtha raudrāḥ khalu durmatiḥ ca
translated: In the eleventh, the rains are called Kālayukta, Siddārtha, Raudra, and Durmati.

original: ādye tu vṣṛṭir mahatī sacaurā śvāso hanūkampayutaś ca kāsaḥ//
analyzed: ādye tu vṣṛṭiḥ mahatī sa caurā śvāsaḥ hanūkampa yutaḥ ca kāsaḥ
translated: In the first, there is great rainfall with thieves, and cough accompanied by shortness of breath and trembling of the jaw.

original: yat kālayuktaṃ tad anekadoṣaṃ siddhārthasaṃjñe bahavo guṇāś ca/
analyzed: yat kāla yuktam tat aneka doṣam siddhārtha saṃjñe bahavaḥ guṇāḥ ca
translated: What is called Kālayukta is full of many faults, and in Siddārtha there are many good qualities.

original: raudro atiraudraḥ kṣayakṛt pradiṣṭo yo durmatir madhyamavṛṣṭikṛt saḥ//
analyzed: raudraḥ ati raudraḥ kṣaya kṛt pradiṣṭaḥ yaḥ durmatiḥ madhyama vṛṣṭi kṛt saḥ
translated: Raudra is said to be extremely terrible and destructive, and Durmati causes medium rainfall.

original: bhāgye yuge dundubhisaṃjñam ādyaṃ sasyasya vṛddhiṃ mahatīṃ karoti/
analyzed: bhāgye yuge dundubhi saṃjñam ādyam sasyasya vṛddhim mahatīm karoti
translated: In the Bhagya Yuga, the first rain is called Dundubhi, which brings about great increase in crops.

original: aṅgārasaṃjñaṃK /udgārisaṃjñaṃ tadanu kṣayāya nareśvarāṇāṃ viṣamā ca vṛṣṭiḥ//
analyzed: tadanu kṣayāya nareśvarāṇām viṣamā ca vṛṣṭiḥ
translated: Then, the rain called Angāra and Kuddāris causes uneven rainfall leading to the destruction of kings.

original: raktākṣam abdaṃ kathitaṃ tṛtīyaṃ tasmin bhayaṃ daṃṣṭrikṛtaṃ gadāś ca/
analyzed: rakta akṣam abdam kathitam tṛtīyam tasmin bhayam daṃṣṭri kṛtam gadāḥ ca
translated: The third year is called Raktākṣa, in which there is danger from fanged creatures and diseases.

original: krodhaṃ bahukrodhakaraṃ caturthaṃ rāṣṭrāṇi śūnyīkurute virodhaiḥ//
analyzed: krodham bahu krodha karam caturtham rāṣṭrāṇi śūnyīkurute virodhaiḥ
translated: The fourth year is called Krodha, which causes much anger and makes countries empty due to conflicts.

analyzed: kṣayam iti yugasya antyasya antyam bahu kṣaya kārakam
translated: Kṣaya is the last of the last Yuga, which causes much destruction.

analyzed: janayati bhayam tat viprāṇām kṛṣī bala vṛddhi dam
translated: It causes fear to Brahmins, but increases the strength of farmers.

analyzed: upacaya karam viś śūdrāṇām para sva hṛtām tathā
translated: It increases the prosperity of Vaishyas and Shudras, and also the stealing of others' wealth.

original: kathitam akhilaṃ ṣaṣṭyabde yat tad atra samāsataḥ//
analyzed: kathitam akhilam ṣaṣṭi abde yat tat atra samāsatas
translated: All that has been described in the sixty-year cycle is summarized here.
He is adorned with the unblemished rays, has a large form, and is white like a jasmine flower or crystal.

original: grahahato na yadi satpathavartī hitakaroK /hatakiro amaragurur manujānām//
analyzed: graha hataḥ na yadi sat patha vartī amara guruḥ manujānām
translated: If he is not afflicted by planets and follows the right path, he is beneficial. The preceptor of the immortals for humans has his rays diminished.

analyzed: śukra cāra adhyāyaḥ
translated: The Chapter on the Movements of Venus

analyzed: nāgagaja airāvata vṛṣabha goja radgava mṛga aja dahana ākhyāḥ
translated: The asterisms named Nāga, Gaja, Airāvaṇa, Vṛṣabha, Go, Jaraḍgava, Mṛga, Aja, and Dhana are known.

original: aśvinyādyāḥ kaiś cit tribhāḥ kramād vīthayaḥ kathitāḥ//
analyzed: aśvinī ādyāḥ kaiḥ cit tri bhāḥ kramāt vīthayaḥ kathitāḥ
translated: Some say that the three-part paths beginning with Aśvinī are in order.

original: nāgā tu pavanayāmyaanalāni paitāmahāt tribhās tisraḥ/
analyzed: tu paitāmahāt tri bhāḥ tisraḥ
translated: Nāga has three parts beginning with Pūrvāphālgunī, Gaja has three parts beginning with Uttarāphālgunī, Airāvaṇa has three parts beginning with Hasta, Vṛṣabha has three parts beginning with Citrā, Go has three parts beginning with Svāti, Jaraḍgava has three parts beginning with Viśākhā, Mṛga has three parts beginning with Anurādhā, Aja has three parts beginning with Jyeṣṭhā, and Dhana has three parts beginning with Mūla.

original: govīthyām aśvinyaḥ pauṣṇaṃ dve caapi bhadrapade//
analyzed: govīthyām aśvinyaḥ pauṣṇam dve ca api bhadrapade
translated: In the Go path, the Aśvinī, Pūrvāphālgunī, and Uttarāphālgunī asterisms are in the west, the two Bhadrapadās are in the south, and the Revatī asterism is in the east.

original: jāradgavyāṃ śravaṇāt tribhaṃ mṛgaākhyā tribhaṃ tu maitraādyam/
analyzed: jāradgavyām śravaṇāt tribham mṛgaākhyā tribham tu maitraādyam
translated: In the Jaraḍgava path, the three parts beginning with Śravaṇa are in the west, the Mṛga asterism is in the south, and the three parts beginning with Maitra are in the east.

analyzed: hasta viśākhā tvāṣṭrāṇi ajaiti aṣāḍhā dvayam dahanā
translated: The Hasta, Viśākhā, and Aśleṣā asterisms are in the south, the two Aṣāḍhā asterisms are in the west, and the Abhijit asterism is in the east.

analyzed: tisraḥ tisraḥ tāsām kramāt udak madhya yāmya mārga sthāḥ
translated: The three asterisms of each of these are respectively located in the north, middle, and south.

analyzed: tāsām api uttara madhya dakṣiṇena
translated: Among them, one is located in the north, one in the middle, and one in the south. One is located in the south.

analyzed: vīthī mārgān apare kathayanti yathāsthitān bha mārgasya
translated: Others describe the paths of the streets as they are, of the lunar mansion.

analyzed: nakṣatrāṇām tārāḥ yāmya uttara madhyamāḥ tadvat
translated: The stars of the lunar mansions are in the south, north, and middle, in the same way.

original: uttaramārgo yāmyaādi nigadito madhyamas tu bhāgyaādyaḥ/
translated: The northern path is said to begin with the south, the middle one begins with Bhadrapada.

original: dakṣiṇamārgoāṣāḍhāādi kaiś cid evaṃ kṛtā mārgāḥ//
analyzed: kaiḥ cit evam kṛtāḥ mārgāḥ
translated: Some have made the southern path begin with Ashadha.

original: jyautiṣamK /jyotisam āgamaśāstraṃ vipratipattau na yogyam asmākam/
analyzed: āgama śāstram vipratipattau na yogyam asmākam
translated: The science of astrology is a scripture of tradition, and in case of disagreement it is not suitable for us.

original: svayam evā vikalpayituṃ kintu bahūnāṃ mataṃ vakṣye//
analyzed: svayam vikalpayitum kintu bahūnām matam vakṣye
translated: We cannot choose for ourselves, but I will speak of the opinion of many.

original: uttaravīthiṣu śukraḥ subhikṣaśivakṛd gato astam udayam caK /vā/
analyzed: uttara vīthiṣu śukraḥ subhikṣa śiva kṛt gataḥ astam udayam cakvā
translated: In the northern paths, Venus, having gone to the west and risen, brings good harvests and happiness.

analyzed: madhyāsu madhya phala daḥ kaṣṭa phalaḥ dakṣiṇa sthāsu
translated: In the middle ones, it gives middling results, and in the southern ones, it gives painful results.

analyzed: atyuttama auttama ūnam sama madhya nyūnam adhama kaṣṭa phalam
translated: Very excellent, excellent, equal, middling, inferior, painful results.

analyzed: kaṣṭataram kaṣṭatamam saumya ādyāsu vīthiṣu yathākramam brūyāt
translated: One should say, in the paths beginning with the gentle ones, respectively, painful, most painful.

analyzed: bharaṇī pūrvam maṇḍalam ṛkṣa catuṣkam subhikṣa karam ādyam
translated: The circle beginning with Bharani, the group of four lunar mansions, is the first one that brings good harvests.

analyzed: vaṅga aṅga mahiṣa bāhlika kvāhlika kaliṅga deśeṣu bhaya jananam
translated: It generates fear in the countries of Vanga, Anga, Mahisha, Vahlika, and Kaliṅga.

original: atrauditam ārohed graho aparo yadi sitaṃ tato hanyāt/
analyzed: atra auditam ārohet grahaḥ aparaḥ yadi sitam tatas hanyāt
translated: If another planet should rise here, it will destroy the white [planet].

analyzed: bhadrāśva śūrasenaka yaudheyaka koṭi varṣa nṛpān
translated: The kings of Bhadrāśva, Śūrasena, Kāyaudha, Koṭivarṣa, and Nṛpa.
The four signs beginning with Ārdrā are the second [quarter], for the abundance of water and crops.

analyzed: viprāṇām aśubha karam viśeṣataḥ krūra ceṣṭānām
translated: It is especially inauspicious for the Brahmins, especially for those of cruel conduct.

analyzed: anyena atra ākrānte
translated: If occupied by another here, it afflicts the Mlecchas, Āṭavikas, Kūṭavikas, horse-keepers, and cow-herds.

analyzed: gonardanīcaśūdrān vaidehān ca anayaḥ spṛśati
translated: It brings misfortune to the Gāṇḍīras, Nīcas, Śūdras, and Vaidehas.

analyzed: vicaran maghā ādi pañcakam uditaḥ sasya praṇāśa kṛt śukraḥ
translated: Śukra, rising in the five signs beginning with Maghā, destroys the crops.

original: kṣuttaskarabhayajanano nīcaunnatisaṅkarakaraś ca//🔽pitryādye avaṣṭabdho hanty anyenaāvikān śabaraśūdrān/
analyzed: pitrya ādye avaṣṭabdhaḥ hanti anyenaāvikān śabara śūdrān
translated: It causes hunger, theft, and fear, and brings about the confusion of low and high.🔽If occupied by another in the Pitriyas, it destroys the sheep, Śabaras, and Śūdras.

analyzed: puṇḍrā aparāntya śūlika vanavāsi draviḍa sāmudrān
translated: It brings misfortune to the Pundras, Aparantas, Śūlikas, forest-dwellers, Draviḍas, and Sāmudras.

original: svātyādyaṃ bhatritayaṃ maṇḍalam etac caturtham abhayakaram/
analyzed: svāti ādyam bha tritayam maṇḍalam etat caturtham abhaya karam
translated: The three signs beginning with Svāti are this fourth circle, which brings safety.

analyzed: brahma kṣatra subhikṣa abhivṛddhaye mitra bhedāya
translated: For the prosperity of Brahmins and Kṣatriyas, and for the increase of food, it causes dissension among friends.

analyzed: atra akrānte mṛtyuḥ kirāta bhartuḥ pinaṣṭi ca aikṣvākūn
translated: If occupied by another here, it brings death to the lord of the Kirātas and destroys the Ikshvākus.

analyzed: pratyanta avanti pulinda taṅgaṇān śūrasenān ca
translated: the people of the border lands, the Avantis, Pulindas, Tanganas, and Surusenas.

analyzed: pañca ṛkṣam kṣudh taskara roga dam prabādhayate
translated: The first five asterisms beginning with Jyeshtha cause hunger, theft, and disease. They afflict

analyzed: kāśmīra aśmaka matsyān sa cārudevīn avantīn ca
translated: Kashmir, Asmaka, Matsya, Charudervi, and Avanti.

analyzed: atra arohet draviḍa ābhīra ambaṣṭhaka ārohe atra ābhīrān draviḍa ambaṣṭha trigarta saurāṣṭrān
translated: Here, the Dravidas, Abhras, Ambashthas, and Karushas should ascend. Here, the Abhras, Dravidas, Ambashthas, Trigartas, and Saurashtras.

analyzed: nāśayanti sindhusauvīrakān ca vadhaḥ
translated: They destroy the Sindhus, Sauviras, and Kashis. The death of the lord of Kashi.

original: ṣaṣṭhaṃ ṣaṇnakṣatraṃ śubham etan maṇḍalaṃ dhaniṣṭhāādyam/
analyzed: ṣaṣṭham ṣaṣ nakṣatram śubham etat maṇḍalam dhaniṣṭhā ādyam
translated: The sixth asterism, consisting of six stars, is auspicious. This circle begins with Dhanishtha.

analyzed: bhūri dhana gokula ākulam analpa dhānyam kva cit sa bhayam
translated: It is full of abundant wealth, cattle, and houses, with plenty of grain, and in some places, fearful.

analyzed: atra ārohecka āroheśūlika gāndhāra avantayaḥ prapīḍyante
translated: Here, the Shulikas, Gandharas, and Avantis should ascend, being oppressed.

analyzed: vaideha vadhaḥ pratyanta yavana śaka dāsa parivṛddhiḥ
translated: The death of Vaideha, and the increase of the border Yavanas, Shakas, and Dasas.

original: aparasyāṃ svātyādyaṃ jyeṣṭhāādyaṃ caapi maṇḍalaṃ śubhadam/
analyzed: aparasyām svāti ādyam jyeṣṭhā ādyam ca api maṇḍalam śubha dam
translated: On the west, the circle beginning with Shravana and Jyeshtha is auspicious.

analyzed: pitrya ādyam pūrvasyām śeṣāṇi yathā ukta phala dāni
translated: The first asterism of the east, Pitri, gives the fruits as stated.

original: dṛṣṭo anastamiteK /anastagate arke bhayakṛt kṣudrogakṛt samastam ahaḥ/
analyzed: dṛṣṭaḥ an astamita ikan asta gate arke bhaya kṛt kṣudh roga kṛt samastam ahar
translated: Seen when the sun has not set, it causes fear and minor illnesses throughout the day.

original: ardhadivaseK /arthadivasaṃ ca saindur nṛpabalapurabhedakṛtśukraḥ//🔽bhindan gato analaṛkṣaṃ kūlātikrāntavārivāhābhiḥ/
analyzed: ca sa ainduḥ nṛpa bala pura bheda kṛt śukraḥ  bhindan gataḥ anala ṛkṣam kūla atikrānta vāri vāhābhiḥ
translated: At half a day, at a day and a half, the moon-accompanied Venus causes the destruction of kings, armies, and cities.🔽Breaking through the fiery asterism, it becomes a river with its waters overflowing the banks.

analyzed: avyakta tuṅga nimnā samā saridbhiḥ bhavati dhātrī
translated: It becomes a river with its waters of indistinct high and low levels.

original: prājāpatye śakaṭe bhinne kṛtvāiva pātakaṃ vasudhā/
analyzed: prājāpatye śakaṭe bhinne kṛtvā iva pātakam vasudhā
translated: When the Prajapati chariot is broken, the earth seems to have committed a sin.

analyzed: keśa asthi śakala śabalā kāpālam iva vratam dhatte
translated: It bears a vow like that of a skull-bearer, with hair and bone fragments scattered about.

analyzed: saumyaupagataḥ rasa sasya saṃkṣayāya auśanāḥ samuddiṣṭaḥ
translated: When the moon enters Taurus, Ushanas is declared for the destruction of juices and crops.

analyzed: ārdrā gataḥ tu kośala kaliṅga hā salila nikara karaḥ
translated: But when it enters Cancer, it brings the destruction of Koshalas and Kalingas, with showers of water.

analyzed: aśmaka vaidarbhāṇām punarvasu sthe site mahān anayaḥ
translated: When the white moon is in Punarvasu, there is great misfortune for the Asmakas and Vidarbhas.

analyzed: puṣye puṣṭā vṛṣṭiḥ vidyādhara raṇau vidyādhara vimardaḥ ca
translated: In Pushya, there is abundant rain, and the Vidyadharas are destroyed.

analyzed: āśleṣāsu bhujaṅgama dāruṇa pīḍā vahaḥ caran śukraḥ
translated: When Venus moves through the Ashlesha asterism, it brings terrible suffering to snakes.

analyzed: bhindan maghām mahāmātra doṣa kṛt bhūri vṛṣṭi karaḥ
translated: Breaking through Magha, it causes great harm to elephants and brings heavy rain.

analyzed: bhāgye śabara pulinda pradhvaṃsa karaḥ ambunivaha mokṣāya
translated: In Bhadrapada, it destroys the Shabaras and Pulindas and releases a flood of water.

analyzed: āryamṇe kurujāṅgala pāñcāla ghnaḥ salila dāyī
translated: In Aryaman, it destroys the Kurus, Jangalas, and Panchalas and brings rain.

original: kauravacitrakarāṇāṃ haste pīḍā jalasya ca nirodhaḥ/
analyzed: kaurava citrakarāṇām haste pīḍā jalasya ca nirodhaḥ
translated: In the Hasta, there is affliction to the artists of the Kaurava clan, and obstruction of water.
In the Citra, there is affliction to the digger of wells and to the egg-born creatures, and good rain.

analyzed: svātau prabhūta vṛṣṭiḥ dūta vaṇij nāvikān spṛśati anayaḥ
translated: In the Svati, there is abundant rain, and misfortune befalls messengers, traders, and shepherds.

original: aindraagne api suvṛṣṭir vaṇijāṃ ca bhayaṃ vijānīyāt//
analyzed: aindraagne api su vṛṣṭiḥ vaṇijām ca bhayam vijānīyāt
translated: In the Indra-Agni (Aśvinī), there is also good rain, and danger to traders should be known.

analyzed: maitre kṣatra virodhaḥ jyeṣṭhāyām kṣatra mukhya santāpaḥ
translated: In the Maitra (Bharaṇī), there is conflict with the warrior class, and in the Jyeṣṭhā, affliction to the chief warriors.

original: maulikabhiṣajām mūle triṣv api caeteṣv anāvṛṣṭiḥ//🔽āpye salilajapīḍā viśveśe vyādhayaḥ prakupyanti/
analyzed: maulika bhiṣajām mūle triṣu api ca eteṣu anāvṛṣṭiḥ  āpye salilaja pīḍāḥ viśveśe vyādhayaḥ prakupyanti
translated: In the Mūla, there is affliction to the physicians and astrologers, and drought in all these three.🔽In the Āpya (Āśleṣā), there is affliction to the water-born creatures, and diseases become aggravated in the Viśvedeva (Magha).

analyzed: śravaṇe śravaṇa vyādhiḥ pākhaṇḍik pāṣaṇḍi bhayam dhaniṣṭhāsu
translated: In the Śravaṇa, there is ear-ache, and danger from heretics in the Dhaniṣṭhā.

analyzed: śatabhiṣaji śauṇḍikānām aja eka bheka jaikape dyūta jīvinām pīḍāṃkpīḍā
translated: In the Śatabhiṣak, there is affliction to distillers, and in the Ajāvi (Ajabh), to gamblers.

original: kurupāñcālānām api karoti caasmin sitaḥ salilam//
analyzed: kuru pāñcālānām api karoti ca asmin sitaḥ salilam
translated: In this (Śravaṇa), the moon causes affliction to the Kuru and Pāñcāla people, and rain.

analyzed: āhirbudhnye phala mūla tāpa kṛt yāyinām ca revatyām
translated: In the Āhirbudhnya (Mūla), it causes affliction to fruits and roots, and to travelers in the Revatī.

analyzed: aśvinyām hayapānām yāmye tu kirāta yavanānām
translated: In the Aśvinī, to those who drink horse-liquor, and in the Yāmya (Bharaṇī), to the Kirātas and Yavanas.

original: caturdaśīṃ pañcadaśīṃ tathāaṣṭamīṃK /caturdaśe pañcadaśe tathāṣṭame tamisrapakṣasya tithiṃK /tithau bhṛgoḥ sutaḥ/
analyzed: caturdaśīm pañcadaśīm tathā aṣṭamīn caturdaśe pañcadaśe tathā aṣṭame tamisra pakṣasya tithiṃk tithau bhṛgoḥ sutaḥ
translated: On the fourteenth, fifteenth, and eighth days of the dark fortnight, when the son of Brihaspati [Mercury] moves to or sets from the asterism of Brihaspati [Taurus],

original: yadā vrajed darśanam astam eti vā tadā mahī vārimayīva lakṣyate//
analyzed: yadā vrajet darśanam astam eti vā tadā mahī vāri mayī iva lakṣyate
translated: then the earth appears as if full of water.

original: gurur bhṛguś caaparapūrvakāṣṭhayoḥ parasparaṃ saptamarāśigau yadā/
analyzed: guruḥ bhṛguḥ ca apara pūrva kāṣṭhayoḥ parasparam saptama rāśi gau yadā
translated: When Jupiter and Venus occupy the fourth and seventh houses respectively,

original: tadā prajā rugbhayaśokapīḍitā na vāri paśyanti purandaraujjhitam//
analyzed: tadā prajāḥ ruj bhaya śoka pīḍitāḥ na vāri paśyanti purandara ojjhitam
translated: then the people are afflicted by disease, fear and sorrow, and do not see water abandoned by Indra.

original: yadā sthitā jīvabudhaārasūryajāḥ sitasya sarve agrapathaanuvartinaḥ/
analyzed: yadā sthitāḥ jīva budha āra sūrya jāḥ sitasya sarve agra patha anuvartinaḥ
translated: When the living beings [Jupiter], Mercury, Venus, the Sun and the Moon are all following in front of Venus,

original: nṛnāgavidyādharasaṅgarās tadā bhavanti vātāś ca samucchritaantakāḥ//
analyzed: nṛ nāga vidyādhara saṅgarāḥ tadā bhavanti vātāḥ ca samucchrita antakāḥ
translated: then there are storms with uplifted trunks, and gatherings of men, elephants and Vidyadharas.

original: na mitrabhāve suhṛdo vyavasthitāḥ kriyāsu samyag na ratā dvijātayaḥ/
analyzed: na mitra bhāve suhṛdaḥ vyavasthitāḥ kriyāsu samyak na ratāḥ dvijātayaḥ
translated: When friends are not established in friendly relations, Brahmins are not engaged in rituals properly,

original: na caalpam apy ambu dadāti vāsavo bhinatti vajreṇa śirāṃsi bhūbhṛtām//
analyzed: na ca alpam api ambu dadāti vāsavaḥ bhinatti vajreṇa śirāṃsi bhūbhṛtām
translated: Indra does not give even a little water, and with his thunderbolt he shatters the heads of the kings.

analyzed: śanaiścare mleccha viḍāla kuñjarāḥ kharāḥ mahiṣyaḥ asita dhānya śūkarāḥ

analyzed: snigdhaḥ tādṛś prācyām śastra ākhyaḥ ḍamara marakāya  dṛśyaḥ amāvāsyāyām kapāla ketuḥ sa dhūmraraśmi śikhaḥ

analyzed: rahasi madana saktayā revayā kāntayā iva aupagūḍham sura adhyāsita audyānam ambhas uśana anna mūla anila āhāra vipra anvitam vindhyam astambhayat  /

analyzed: yaḥ ca tasya odayaḥ śrūyatām

translated: The waters become clear again, as if the hearts of the good are naturally so.🔽The autumn river, with a line of noisy geese nourishing the pair of ruddy geese resting on both banks,🔽shines like a young woman with red betel-stained upper teeth.

translated: shines like a clever young woman with arched brows, sidelong glances, and amorous glances.

original: indoḥ payodavigamopahitāṃ vibhūtiṃ🔽draṣṭuṃ taraṅgavalayā kumudaṃ niśāsu/🔽unmīlayaty alinilīnadalaṃ supakṣma

translated: like a woman with dark pupils, to see the moon, the lover of the night, free from clouds.🔽With its hands full of ponds filled with various colorful lotuses, geese, ducks, and ruddy geese,🔽it seems to offer abundant gems, flowers, and fruits to the one named Agastya.

translated: When the fire of the poison generated by serpents is inflamed, it becomes auspicious by the sight of Agastya.

analyzed: munibhiḥ kathitaḥ asya yathā argha vidhiḥ kathayāmi narendra hitam
translated: I shall relate the same method of worship as narrated by the sages, which is beneficial to kings.

original: saṃkhyāvidhānāt pratideśam asya vijñāya sandarśanam ādiśej jñaḥ/
analyzed: saṃkhyā vidhānāt pratideśam asya vijñāya sandarśanam ādiśet jñaḥ
translated: Having known the number and direction of this, the wise one should indicate the sight.

original: tac caujjayinyāmK /ujjayanyām agatasya kanyāṃ bhāgaiḥ svarākhyaiḥ sphuṭabhāskarasya//🔽īṣatprabhinne aruṇaraśmijālair naiśe andhakāre diśi dakṣiṇasyām/

translated: A Brahmin, having offered Arghya according to his means, obtains the Vedas, women, and sons.

translated: If inauspicious [results] are seen in the year, they increase in the month.

analyzed: śubha phalam api ca evam yāpyam anyonya tāyām
translated: And auspicious results should also be considered in the same way in mutual [aspects].

analyzed: grahaśṛṅgāṭaka adhyāyaḥ
translated: The Chapter on the Configurations of the Planets

original: yasyāṃ diśi dṛśyante viśanti tārāgrahā raviṃ sarve/
analyzed: yasyām diśi dṛśyante viśanti tārā grahāḥ ravim sarve
translated: In whatever direction the stars and planets are seen to enter the sun,

analyzed: bhavati bhayam diśi tasyām āyudha kopa kṣudhā ā ātaṅkaiḥ
translated: in that direction there is danger from weapons, anger, hunger, and calamities.

analyzed: cakra dhanuḥ śṛṅgāṭaka daṇḍa pura prāsa vajra saṃsthānāḥ
translated: Having the shapes of a discus, bow, arrow, staff, city, spear, or thunderbolt,

analyzed: kṣudh vṛṣṭi kara ākūa vṛṣṭi karāḥ loke samarāya ca mānava aindrāṇām
translated: they bring hunger, rain, and drought in the world, and war among humans and gods.

original: yasmin khāṃśe dṛśyā grahamālā dinakare dināntagate/
analyzed: yasmin kha aṃśe dṛśyā graha mālā dinakare dina anta gate
translated: In whatever part of the sky the row of planets is seen at sunset,

original: tatra anyo bhavati nṛpaḥ paracakraupadravaś ca mahān//
analyzed: tatra anyaḥ bhavati nṛpaḥ para cakra aupadravaḥ ca mahān
translated: in that place another king arises and there is great danger from the armies of enemies.

original: tasminnK /yasminn ṛkṣe kuryuḥ samāgamaṃ tajjanān grahā hanyuḥ/
analyzed: tasmin kyasmin ṛkṣe kuryuḥ samāgamam tad janān grahāḥ hanyuḥ
translated: In that constellation in which they would make a conjunction, the planets would strike those people.

analyzed: avibhedinaḥ kavi bhedanāḥ parasparam amala mayūkhāḥ śivāḥ teṣām
translated: May their rays be undivided, mutually pure, and auspicious.

analyzed: graha saṃvarta samāgama sammoha samāja sannipāta ākhyāḥ
translated: The names of the conjunctions are Saṃvarta, Saṃgama, Sammoha, Samāja, and Saṃnipāta.

original: kośaś cety eteṣām abhidhāsye lakṣaṇaṃ saphalaṃ//
analyzed: kośaḥ ca iti eteṣām abhidhāsye lakṣaṇam saphalam
translated: And Kośa - I will describe the characteristics of these with their results.

original: ekaṛkṣe catvāraḥ saha paurair yāyino atha vā pañca/
analyzed: eka ṛkṣe catvāraḥ saha pauraiḥ yāyinaḥ atha vā pañca
translated: In one constellation, there are four or five people traveling together with the citizens.

analyzed: saṃvartaḥ nāma bhavet śikhiḥ āhu yutaḥ sa sammohaḥ
translated: If it is accompanied by the planet Ketu, it is called Saṃvarta and Sammoha.

original: pauraḥ paurasameto yāyī saha yāyinā samājākhyaḥ/
analyzed: pauraḥ paura sametaḥ yāyī saha yāyinā samāja ākhyaḥ
translated: If a citizen is accompanied by citizens, and a traveler by travelers, it is called Samāja.

original: yamajīvasaṅgame anyo yady āgacchet tadā kośaḥ//
analyzed: yama jīva saṅgame anyaḥ yadi āgacchet tadā kośaḥ
translated: If another person comes to the meeting of Yama and Jiva, then it is Kośa.

original: uditaḥ paścād ekaḥ prāk cānyo yadi sa sannipātākhyaḥ/
analyzed: uditaḥ paścāt ekaḥ prāk ca anyaḥ yadi sa sannipāta ākhyaḥ
translated: If one rises in the west and another in the east, then it is called Saṃnipāta.

original: avikṛtatanavaḥ snigdhā vipulāś ca samāgame dhanyāḥ//🔽samau tu saṃvartasamāgamākhyau sammohakośau bhayadau prajānām/
analyzed: a vikṛta tanavaḥ snigdhāḥ vipulāḥ ca samāgame dhanyāḥ  samau tu saṃvarta samāgama ākhyau sammoha kośau bhaya dau prajānām
translated: In a conjunction, the bodies are unaltered, smooth, and large, and are auspicious.🔽But Saṃvarta and Saṃgama are called Saṃmoha and Kośa, and they bring fear to the people.

original: samājasaṃjño susamā pradiṣṭāK /samājñaḥ susamaḥ pradiṣṭo vairaprakopaḥ khalu sannipāte//
analyzed: samāja saṃjñaḥ su samaḥ pradiṣṭaḥ vaira prakopaḥ khalu sannipāte
translated: Samāja is declared to be very auspicious, but in Saṃnipāta, enmity and anger are indeed declared.

analyzed: garbha lakṣaṇa adhyāyaḥ
translated: Chapter on the Characteristics of Pregnancy

original: annaṃ jagataḥ prāṇāḥ prāvṛṭkālasya cānnam āyattam/
analyzed: annam jagataḥ prāṇāḥ prāvṛṣ kālasya ca annam āyattam
translated: Food is the life of the world, and the rainy season depends on food.

analyzed: yasmāt atas parīkṣyaḥ prāvṛṣ kālaḥ prayatnena
translated: Therefore, the rainy season should be carefully examined.

original: tallakṣaṇāni munibhir yāni nibaddhāni tāni dṛṣṭvāidam/
analyzed: tad lakṣaṇāni munibhiḥ yāni nibaddhāni tāni dṛṣṭvā idam
translated: Having seen the characteristics of that which have been composed by the sages,

analyzed: kriyate garga parāśara kāśyapa vajra ādi kvātsya ādi racitāni
translated: this is being composed by Garga, Parashara, Kashyapa, Vajra, and others.

original: daivavid avihitacittoK /avahitacitto dyuniśaṃ yo garbhalakṣaṇe bhavati/
analyzed: daiva vid a vihita citta ukavahita cittaḥ dyuniśam yaḥ garbha lakṣaṇe bhavati
translated: The one who is not attentive to the mind not directed by the knower of destiny, who is attentive to the mind directed, who is in the characteristics of pregnancy day and night,

original: tasya muner iva vāṇī na bhavati mithyāmbunirdeśe//
analyzed: tasya muneḥ iva vāṇī na bhavati mithyā ambu nirdeśe
translated: his speech is not false in the indication of water, like that of a sage.

original: kiṃ vātaḥ param anyatśāstrajyāyoK /śāstraṃ jyāyo asti yad viditvāeva/
analyzed: kim vā atas param anyat śāstra jyāyaḥ ukśāstram jyāyaḥ asti yat viditvā eva
translated: What else is superior to the wind? There is a superior scripture by knowing which,

original: pradhvaṃsiny api kāle trikāladarśī kalau bhavati//
analyzed: pradhvaṃsini api kāle tri kāla darśī kalau bhavati
translated: one becomes a seer of the three times even in the perishable age of Kali.

original: ke cid vadanti kārtikaK /kārttikaśuklāntam atītya garbhadivasāḥ syuḥ/
analyzed: ke cid vadanti kārtika kkārttikaśukla antam atītya garbha divasāḥ syuḥ
translated: Some say that the days of pregnancy should be counted from the end of the bright fortnight of Kartika.

original: na caK /tu tanmataṃ bahūnāṃ gargaādīnāṃ mataṃ vakṣye//
analyzed: tat matam bahūnām garga ādīnām matam vakṣye
translated: But that opinion is not accepted by many. I will state the opinion of Garga and others.

analyzed: mārgaśiraḥ sita kmārgaśira śukla pakṣa pratipad prabhṛti kṣapākare aṣāḍhām
translated: From the first day of the bright fortnight of Margashirsha, when the moon is in the constellation Ashadha,

original: pūrvāṃ vā samupagate garbhāṇāṃ lakṣaṇam jñeyam//
analyzed: pūrvām vā samupagate garbhāṇām lakṣaṇam jñeyam
translated: Or, when the previous [lunar day] has passed, the characteristics of the embryos should be known.

original: yannakṣatram upagate garbhaś candre bhavet sa candravaśāt/
analyzed: yat nakṣatram upagate garbhaḥ candre bhavet sa candra vaśāt
translated: If a conception occurs under a lunar mansion, and the moon is present, the embryo is born under the influence of the moon.

original: pañcanavate dinaśate tatraeva prasavam āyāti//🔽sitapakṣabhavāḥ kṛṣṇe śukle kṛṣṇā dyusambhavā rātrau/
analyzed: pañcanavate dina śate tatra eva prasavam āyāti  sita pakṣa bhavāḥ kṛṣṇe śukle kṛṣṇāḥ div sambhavāḥ rātrau
translated: After 59 days, it gives birth to a child.

analyzed: naktaṃprabhavāḥ ca ahani sandhyā jātāḥ ca sandhyāyām
translated: Those born in the bright fortnight are born in the dark fortnight, those born in the dark fortnight are born in the bright fortnight, those born in the day are born at night, those born at night are born in the day, and those born in the twilight are born in the twilight.

analyzed: mṛgaśīrṣa ādyāḥ garbhāḥ manda phalāḥ pauṣa śukla jātāḥ ca
translated: The embryos born under Mṛgaśiras and other [lunar mansions] have slow results, and those born in the bright fortnight of Pauṣa.

analyzed: pauṣasya kṛṣṇa pakṣeṇa nirdiśet śrāvaṇasya sitam
translated: By the dark fortnight of Pauṣa, one should predict the bright fortnight of Śrāvaṇa.

analyzed: māgha sita utthāḥ garbhāḥ śrāvaṇa kṛṣṇe prasūtim āyānti
translated: The embryos born in the bright fortnight of Māgha give birth in the dark fortnight of Śrāvaṇa.
By the dark fortnight of Māgha, one should predict the bright fortnight of Bhādrapada.
Those born in the bright fortnight of Phālguna should be predicted in the dark fortnight of Bhādrapada.

original: tasyaiva kṛṣṇapakṣaudbhavās tu ye te aśvayukśukle//🔽caitrasitapakṣajātāḥ kṛṣṇe aśvayujasya vāridā garbhāḥ/
analyzed: tasya eva kṛṣṇa pakṣa odbhavāḥ tu ye te aśvayuj śukle  caitra sita pakṣa jātāḥ kṛṣṇe aśvayujasya vāri dāḥ garbhāḥ
translated: Those born in the dark fortnight of that [month] are born in the bright fortnight of Āśvina.🔽The embryos born in the bright fortnight of Caitra give birth in the dark fortnight of Āśvina.🔽Those born in the dark fortnight of Caitra give birth in the bright fortnight of Kārttika.

analyzed: caitra asita sambhūtāḥ kārtika śukla i kārttika śukle abhivarṣanti
translated: Those born in the bright fortnight of Kārttika give birth in the rainy season.

original: pūrvaudbhūtāḥ paścād aparotthāḥ prāg bhavanti jīmūtāḥ/
analyzed: pūrva audbhūtāḥ paścāt apara utthāḥ prāk bhavanti jīmūtāḥ
translated: The clouds that rise first in the east appear later in the west.

original: śeṣāsv api dikṣv evaṃ viparyayo bhavati vāyoś ca//🔽hlādimṛduudakśivaśakradigbhavo māruto viyadvimalam/
analyzed: śeṣāsu api dikṣu evam viparyayaḥ bhavati vāyoḥ ca
translated: In the other directions also, it is the reverse, and so is the case with the wind.🔽The wind blowing from the north, east, and northeast is pleasant and soft, and the sky is clear.

analyzed: snigdha sita bahula pariveṣa parivṛtau hima maya kha arka okū mayūkha arkau
translated: When the sun and moon are surrounded by a halo of thick, white clouds,

analyzed: pṛthu bahula snigdha ghanam ghana sūci kṣuraka lohita abhra yutam                    sura cāpa mandra garjita vidyut pratisūrya kāc pratisūryakāḥ śubhā sandhyā
translated: when the clouds are thick, large, soft, and dense, mixed with clouds of the color of a needle, razor, or blood,🔽and the sky has the color of a crow's wing or a peacock's neck, and the moon and stars are clear,🔽when there is a rainbow, thunder, lightning, and sun dogs, the evening is auspicious.

original: śaśiśivaśakraāśāsthāḥ śāntaravāḥ pakṣimṛgasaṅghāḥ//🔽vipulāḥ pradakṣiṇacarāḥ snigdhamayūkhā grahā nirupasargāḥ/
analyzed: śaśi śiva śakra āśā sthāḥ śānta ravāḥ pakṣi mṛga saṅghāḥ  vipulāḥ pradakṣiṇa carāḥ snigdha mayūkhāḥ grahāḥ nirupasargāḥ
translated: Flocks of birds and animals are quiet, staying in the directions of the moon, sun, and Indra.🔽The planets move in large circles to the right, with clear rays and without obstacles.

original: taravaś ca nirupasṛṣṭaaṅkurā naracatuṣpadā hṛṣṭāḥ//🔽garbhāṇāṃ puṣṭikarāḥ sarveṣām eva yo atra tu viśeṣaḥ/
analyzed: taravaḥ ca nirupasṛṣṭa aṅkurāḥ nara catuṣpadāḥ hṛṣṭāḥ  garbhāṇām puṣṭi karāḥ sarveṣām eva yaḥ atra tu viśeṣaḥ
translated: The trees have shoots without parasites, and men and animals are cheerful.🔽They nourish all embryos, but there is a special feature here.

analyzed: sva ṛtu svabhāva janitaḥ garbha vivṛddhyā e kvivṛddhau tam abhidhāsye
translated: What is produced by the nature of one's own season is for the growth of the embryo. I will describe that in the growth.
In Pausha and Margashirsha, the evening glow, clouds with halos,

analyzed: na atyartham mṛgaśīrṣe śītam pauṣe ati hima pātaḥ
translated: In Mrigashira, not too much cold, in Pausha, heavy snowfall.

analyzed: māghe prabalaḥ vāyuḥ tuṣāra kaluṣa dyutī ravi śaśāṅkau
translated: In Magha, the wind is strong, the sun and moon have luster tainted by frost.

original: atiśītaṃ saghanasya ca bhānor astodayau dhanyau//🔽phālgunamāse rūkṣaś caṇḍaḥ pavano abhrasamplavāḥ snigdhāḥ/
analyzed: ati śītam sa ghanasya ca bhānoḥ asta udayau dhanyau  phālguna māse rūkṣaḥ caṇḍaḥ pavanaḥ abhra samplavāḥ snigdhāḥ
translated: The rise and set of the sun are auspicious, with heavy cold and clouds.🔽In the month of Phalguna, the wind is rough and strong, the clouds are moist,

original: pariveṣāś cāsakalāḥ kapilas tāmro raviś ca śubhaḥ//🔽pavanaghanavṛṣṭiyuktāś caitre garbhāḥ śubhāḥ sapariveṣāḥ/
analyzed: pariveṣāḥ ca a sakalāḥ kapilaḥ tāmraḥ raviḥ ca śubhaḥ  pavana ghana vṛṣṭi yuktāḥ caitre garbhāḥ śubhāḥ sa pariveṣāḥ
translated: And the halos are incomplete, but the reddish brown sun is auspicious.🔽In Chaitra, the embryos are auspicious with wind, clouds, rain, and halos,

original: ghanapavanasalilavidyutstanitaiś ca hitāya vaiśākhe//🔽muktārajatanikāśāstamālanīlotpalaañjanaābhāsaḥ/🔽jalacarasattvākārā grabheṣu ghanāḥ prabhūtajalāḥ//
analyzed: ghana pavana salila vidyut stanitaiḥ ca hitāya vaiśākhe                  jalacara sattva ākārāḥ grabheṣu ghanāḥ prabhūta jalāḥ
translated: And in Vaishakha, clouds, wind, water, lightning, and thunder are beneficial.🔽Clouds resembling pearls, silver, tamala, blue lotus, and collyrium,🔽With the forms of aquatic creatures, abundant water, and the shape of embryos.

analyzed: tīvra divākara kiraṇa abhitāpitāḥ manda mārutāḥ jaladāḥ
translated: Clouds heated by the intense rays of the sun during the day, and gently by the wind,

original: ruṣitā iva dhārābhir visṛjanty ambhaḥ prasavakāle//
analyzed: ruṣitāḥ iva dhārābhiḥ visṛjanti ambhaḥ prasava kāle
translated: As if angry, release water with torrents at the time of delivery.

analyzed: garbha aupaghāta liṅgāni ulkā aśani pāṃśu pāta digdāhaḥ
translated: The signs of harm to embryos are falling meteors, lightning, dust, and burning in the directions,

analyzed: kṣiti kampa kha pura kīlaka ketu graha yuddha nirghātāḥ
translated: Earthquakes, the striking of the city walls, the appearance of comets, battles, and storms,

analyzed: rudhira ādi vṛṣṭi vaikṛta parigha aindra dhanūṃṣi darśanam rāhoḥ
translated: Rain of blood and other such calamities, rainbows, and the appearance of Rahu [in an eclipse],

original: ity utpātair etais trividhaiś cānyair hato garbhaḥ//🔽svartusvabhāvajanitaiḥ sāmānyair yaiś ca lakṣaṇair vṛddhiḥ/
analyzed: iti utpātaiḥ etaiḥ trividhaiḥ ca anyaiḥ hataḥ garbhaḥ  sva ṛtu svabhāva janitaiḥ sāmānyaiḥ yaiḥ ca lakṣaṇaiḥ vṛddhiḥ
translated: These and other such three-fold portents destroy the fetus.🔽The growth of fetuses is indicated by general characteristics produced by the natural course of the season,

original: garbhāṇām viparītais tair eva viparyayo bhavati//
analyzed: garbhāṇām viparītaiḥ taiḥ eva viparyayaḥ bhavati
translated: And their adverse conditions are indicated by the same characteristics in reverse.

analyzed: bhadrapadā dvaya viśvāmbu devak daivapaitāmaheṣu atha ṛkṣeṣu
translated: In the asterisms Bhadrapada, Ashlesha, Vishakha, Amba, Deva, and Pitri,

original: sarveṣv ṛtuṣu vivṛddho garbho bahutoyado bhavati//
analyzed: sarveṣu ṛtuṣu vivṛddhaḥ garbhaḥ bahu toya daḥ bhavati
translated: A fetus grows in all seasons and becomes very watery.

analyzed: śatabhiṣaj āśleṣā ārdrā svāti maghā saṃyutaḥ śubhaḥ garbhaḥ
translated: A fetus is auspicious when associated with Shatabhisha, Ashlesha, Ardra, Svati, and Magha.

original: puṣṇāti bahūn divasān hanty utpātair hatas trividhaiḥ//
analyzed: puṣṇāti bahūn divasān hanti utpātaiḥ hataḥ trividhaiḥ
translated: It nourishes for many days and is destroyed by portents of three kinds.

original: mṛgamāsaādiṣv aṣṭau ṣaṭ ṣoḍaśa viṃśatiś caturyuktā/
analyzed: mṛgamāsa ādiṣu aṣṭau ṣaḍ ṣoḍaśa viṃśatiḥ catur yuktā
translated: In the months beginning with Mriga, there are eight, six, sixteen, twenty, and twenty-four,

analyzed: viṃśatiḥ atha divasa trayam ekatama ṛkṣeṇa pañcabhyaḥ
translated: Twenty, and three days with each asterism, from five [to twenty-four].

original: K / // pañcanimittaiḥ śatayojanaṃ tadardhaardham ekahānyā ataḥ/
analyzed: pañca nimittaiḥ śata yojanam tad ardha ardham eka hānyāḥ atas
translated: The fetus grows five hundred yojanas with five causes, half of that with half, and one less with one less.

original: K / // varṣati pañcanimittādK /pañcasamantād rūpeṇaekena yo garbhaḥ//
analyzed: varṣati pañca nimittāt k pañca samantāt rūpeṇa ekena yaḥ garbhaḥ
translated: If it rains, from the five signs, from the five directions, with one form, that which is a fetus.

original: K / // droṇaḥ pañcanimitte garbhe trīṇy āḍhakāni pavanena/
analyzed: droṇaḥ pañca nimitte garbhe trīṇi āḍhakāni pavanena
translated: In a fetus with five signs, three aḍhakas with wind.

original: K / // ṣaḍ vidyutā navābhraiḥ stanitena dvādaśa prasave//
analyzed: ṣaṭ vidyutā nava abhraiḥ stanitena dvādaśa prasave
translated: Six with lightning, nine with clouds, twelve with thunder.

analyzed: krūra graha saṃyukte karakā aśani matsya varṣa dāḥ garbhāḥ
translated: Fetus-giving rains with cruel planets, hail, thunder, and fish.

analyzed: śaśini ravau vā śubha saṃyuta īkṣite bhūri vṛṣṭi karāḥ
translated: If the moon or sun is joined with or aspected by benefics, they bring much rain.

analyzed: ati vṛṣṭiḥ garbha abhāvāya nirnimitta kṛtā
translated: Excessive rain at the time of conception is for the loss of the fetus, made without cause.

original: droṇāṣṭāṃśe abhyadhike vṛṣṭe garbhaḥ sruto bhavati//
analyzed: droṇa aṣṭa aṃśe abhyadhike vṛṣṭe garbhaḥ srutaḥ bhavati
translated: If it rains more than eight drona parts, the fetus is aborted.

original: garbhaḥ puṣṭaḥ prasave grahaupaghātaādibhir yadi na vṛṣṭaḥ/
analyzed: garbhaḥ puṣṭaḥ prasave graha aupaghāta ādibhiḥ yadi na vṛṣṭaḥ
translated: If the fetus is not rained on by the planets' afflictions, etc., at the time of conception, it is nourished.

original: ātmīyagarbhasamaye karakāmiśraṃ dadāty ambhaḥ//🔽kāṭhinyaṃ yāti yathā cirakāladhṛtaṃ payaḥ payasvinyāḥ/
analyzed: ātmīya garbha samaye karakā miśram dadāti ambhaḥ  kāṭhinyam yāti yathā cira kāla dhṛtam payaḥ payasvinyāḥ
translated: At the time of one's own conception, it gives water mixed with hail.🔽Just as milk held for a long time by a milch cow becomes solid,

analyzed: kāla atītam tadvat salilam kāṭhinyam upayāti
translated: in the same way, water that has passed its time becomes solid.
That which is accompanied by wind, water, lightning, thunder, and clouds,

analyzed: sa bhavati bahu toyaḥ pañca rūpa abhyupetaḥ
translated: becomes one with much water and five forms.

analyzed: visṛjati yadi toyam garbha kāle ati bhūri
translated: If it releases a lot of water during the time of pregnancy,

analyzed: prasava samayam itvā śīkara ambhaḥ karoti
translated: and makes a shower of water at the time of delivery.

analyzed: garbha dhāraṇa adhyāyaḥ
translated: Chapter on Bearing Pregnancy

analyzed: jyaiṣṭha site aṣṭamyā ādyaḥ catvāraḥ vāyu dhāraṇāḥ divasāḥ
translated: The four days starting from the eighth day of the bright fortnight of Jyaishtha are for bearing the wind.

analyzed: mṛdu śubha pavanāḥ śastāḥ snigdha ghana sthagita gaganāḥ ca
translated: The soft and auspicious winds are recommended, and the sky covered with moist and dense clouds.

analyzed: tatra eva svāti ādye vṛṣṭe bha catuṣṭaye kramāt māsāḥ
translated: On those very days, starting from Svatyada, the four months are in order.

original: śrāvaṇapūrvā jñeyāḥ parisrutā dhāraṇās tāḥ syuḥ/
