original: nirjitaaribhir ivaamarair naraiḥ śakravat parivṛto vrajen nṛpaḥ//
analyzed: nirjita aribhiḥ iva amaraiḥ naraiḥ śakra vat parivṛtaḥ vrajet nṛpaḥ
translated: and with men as if the enemies are conquered by the immortals, surrounded like Shakra.

analyzed: sa vajra muktāphala bhūṣaṇaḥ atha vā sita sraj uṣṇīṣa vilepana ambaraḥ
translated: Or with ornaments of diamonds, pearls and fruits, with a white garland, turban, unguents and garments,

original: dhṛtaātapatro gajapṛṣṭham āśrito ghanaupariivaindutale bhṛgoḥ sutaḥ//
analyzed: dhṛta ātapatraḥ gaja pṛṣṭham āśritaḥ bhṛgoḥ sutaḥ
translated: holding a parasol, seated on an elephant's back, like Brihaspati's son on the surface of the moon amidst clouds.

analyzed: samprahṛṣṭa nara vāji kuñjaram nirmala praharaṇa aṃśu bhāsuram
translated: When the army is delighted with men, horses and elephants, shining with the luster of spotless weapons,

original: nirvikāram aripakṣabhīṣaṇaṃ yasya sainyam acirāt sa gāṃ jayet//
analyzed: nirvikāram ari pakṣa bhīṣaṇam yasya sainyam acirāt sa gām jayet
translated: without any disturbance, terrifying to the enemy faction, he will soon conquer the earth.

analyzed: khañjanaka lakṣaṇa adhyāyaḥ
translated: The Chapter on the Auspicious Signs of the Cakravāka Bird

original: khañjanako nāmaayaṃ yo vihagas tasya darśane prathame/
analyzed: khañjanakaḥ nāma ayam yaḥ vihagaḥ tasya darśane prathame
translated: This bird named the Cakravāka, when seen for the first time,

original: proktāni yāni munibhiḥ phalāni tāni pravakṣyāmi//🔽sthūloabhyunnatakaṇṭhaḥ kṛṣṇagalo bhadrakārako bhadraḥ/🔽ākaṇṭhamukhāt kṛṣṇaḥ sampūrṇaḥ pūrayaty āśām//
analyzed: proktāni yāni munibhiḥ phalāni tāni pravakṣyāmi  sthūlaḥ abhyunnata kaṇṭhaḥ kṛṣṇa galaḥ bhadra kārakaḥ bhadraḥ  ā kaṇṭha mukhāt kṛṣṇaḥ sampūrṇaḥ pūrayati āśām
translated: I will describe the results that have been mentioned by the sages.🔽One with a large body, raised neck, black throat, is auspicious and brings good fortune.🔽From the neck to the face, black, complete, fulfills one's desires.

original: kṛṣṇo gale asya binduḥ sitakaraṭāntaḥ sa riktakṛd riktaḥ/
analyzed: kṛṣṇaḥ gale asya binduḥ sita karaṭa antaḥ sa rikta kṛt riktaḥ
translated: On his neck, a black spot, inside the white forehead, he is empty-making, empty.

original: pīto gopīta iti kleśakaraḥ khañjano dṛṣṭaḥ//
analyzed: pītaḥ gopītaḥ iti kleśa karaḥ khañjanaḥ dṛṣṭaḥ
translated: The Khakhanaja bird seen in yellow or brown color is troublesome.

analyzed: atha madhura surabhi phala kusuma taruṣu salilāśayeṣu puṇyeṣu  kari turaga bhujaga mūrdhni prāsāda audyāna harmyeṣu
translated: Then, in trees with sweet-smelling flowers and fruits, in auspicious water reservoirs,🔽On the heads of elephants, horses and snakes, in palaces, gardens and mansions,

analyzed: go goṣṭha sat samāgama yajña autsava pārthiva dvija samīpe  hasti turaṅgama śālā chatra dhvaja cāmara ādyeṣu
translated: In cow pens, in the company of the good, in sacrifices, festivals, near kings and Brahmins,🔽In stables of elephants and horses, in umbrellas, flags, chowries and other things,

analyzed: hema samīpa sita ambara kamala autpala pūjita aupalipteṣu  dadhi pātra dhānya kūṭeṣu ca śriyam khañjanaḥ kurute
translated: In places anointed with gold, near garments, lotuses, water lilies, worshipped with gems,🔽In curds, milk, and grain heaps, the Khakhanaja bird brings prosperity.

original: paṅke svādvannaāptir gorasasampac ca gomayaupagate/🔽śādvalage vastraāptiḥ śakaṭasthe deśavibhraṃśaḥ//
analyzed: paṅke svādu anna āptiḥ go rasa sampad ca gomaya aupagate  śādvala ge vastra āptiḥ śakaṭa sthe deśa vibhraṃśaḥ
translated: In mud, there is attainment of sweet food, and abundance of cow products when approaching cow dung.🔽In green grass, there is attainment of clothes, and when on a cart, there is loss of country.

original: gṛhapaṭale arthabhraṃśo badhreK /vadhre bandho aśucau bhavati rogaḥ/
analyzed: gṛha paṭale artha bhraṃśaḥ badhrekvadhre bandhaḥ aśucau bhavati rogaḥ
translated: In a house wall, there is loss of wealth, in a well, there is imprisonment, and in an impure place, there is disease.

analyzed: pṛṣṭhe tu aja āvikānām priya saṅgamam āvahati āśu
translated: But on the back of goats and sheep, it quickly brings pleasant company.🔽On the bones of buffaloes, camels, donkeys, in cremation grounds, house corners, on sand, in a threshing floor, on a mountain,

analyzed: prākāra bhasma keśeṣu ca aśubhaḥ maraṇa ruj bhaya daḥ
translated: In walls, ashes, and hair, it brings inauspiciousness, danger of death and illness.

original: pakṣau dhunvan na śubhaḥ śubhaḥ piban vāri nimnagāsaṃsthaḥ/
analyzed: pakṣau dhunvan na śubhaḥ śubhaḥ piban vāri nimnagā saṃsthaḥ
translated: Shaking its wings, not auspicious; auspicious if drinking water while standing in a low-lying river.

original: sūryodaye praśastoK /atha śasto naiṣṭaphalaḥ khañjano astamaye//🔽nīrājane nivṛtte yayā diśā khañjanaṃ nṛpo yāntam/
analyzed: sūrya udaye śastaḥ naiṣṭaphalaḥ khañjanaḥ astamaye  nīrājane nivṛtte yayā diśā khañjanam nṛpaḥ yāntam
translated: At sunrise, if the sparrow is praised, then it is praised and bestows desired results at sunset.🔽When the ceremonial waving of lights is over, in whatever direction the king sees the sparrow going,

original: paśyet tayā gatasya kṣipram arātir vaśam upaiti//🔽tasmin nidhir bhavati maithunam eti yasmin
analyzed: paśyet tayā gatasya kṣipram arātiḥ vaśam upaiti  tasmin nidhiḥ bhavati maithunam eti yasmin
translated: by going in that direction, the enemy quickly comes under his control.🔽In which it finds a treasure, in which it copulates,

original: yasmiṃs tu chardayati tatra tale asti kācam/
analyzed: yasmin tu chardayati tatra tale asti kācam
translated: in which it vomits, on that spot there is glass.

analyzed: aṅgāram api upadiśanti purīṣaṇe asya
translated: They also indicate charcoal in its feces.

analyzed: tad kautuka apanayanāya khanet dharitrīm
translated: For the removal of that curiosity, one should dig the earth.
The bird gives results equal to its own body from death, weakness, separation, and disease.

analyzed: dhana kṛt abhinilīyamānakaḥ viyati ca bandhu samāgama pradaḥ
translated: It brings wealth if seen descending in the sky, and brings reunion with relatives in the sky.

original: nṛpatir api śubhaṃ śubhapradeśe khagam avalokya mahītale vidadhyāt/
analyzed: nṛpatiḥ api śubham śubha pradeśe khagam avalokya mahī tale vidadhyāt
translated: Even a king, seeing an auspicious bird in an auspicious place on the ground, should offer it worship.

original: surabhikusumadhūpayuktam arghaṃ śubham abhinandimK /ū /abhinanditam evam eti vṛddhim//
analyzed: surabhi kusuma dhūpa yuktam argham śubham evam eti vṛddhim
translated: An auspicious offering consisting of fragrant flowers and incense, when accepted, thus brings prosperity.

original: aśubham api vilokya khañjanaṃ dvijagurusādhusuraarcane rataḥ/
analyzed: aśubham api vilokya khañjanam dvija guru sādhu sura arcane rataḥ
translated: Even if he sees inauspicious things, if the king is devoted to worshipping Brahmins, elders, virtuous people, and gods,

original: na nṛpatir aśubhaṃ samāpnuyātK /samāpnuyān na yadi dināni ca sapta māṃsabhuk//
analyzed: na nṛpatiḥ aśubham samāpnuyāt ksamāpnuyāt na yadi dināni ca sapta māṃsa bhuj
translated: he will not experience inauspiciousness, if he does not eat meat for seven days.

original: āvarṣāt prathame darśane phalaṃ pratidinaṃ tu dinaśeṣātK /dinaśeṣe/
analyzed: ā varṣāt prathame darśane phalam pratidinam tu dina śeṣāt k dina śeṣe
translated: From the rainy season, the result is seen in the first appearance, but from the remaining days of the day, from the remaining days of the day.

analyzed: diś sthāna mūrti lagna ṛkṣa śānta dīpta ādibhiḥ ca ūhyam
translated: It should be inferred by the directions, places, forms, ascendants, lunar mansions, peace, brilliance, etc.

analyzed: utpāta adhyāyaḥ
translated: The Chapter on Omens

original: yān atrer utpātān gargaḥ provāca tān ahaṃ vakṣye/
analyzed: yān atreḥ utpātān gargaḥ provāca tān aham vakṣye
translated: I will describe the omens that Garga spoke of to Atri.

original: teṣāṃ saṃkṣepo ayaṃ prakṛter anyatvam utpātaḥ//
analyzed: teṣām saṃkṣepaḥ ayam prakṛteḥ anya tvam utpātaḥ
translated: Their summary is this: an omen is a deviation from the natural state.

analyzed: apacāreṇa narāṇām upasargaḥ pāpa sañcayāt bhavati
translated: Due to the misconduct of men, an affliction arises from the accumulation of sin.

analyzed: saṃsūcayanti divya āntarikṣa bhaumāḥ te utpātāḥ k tad utpātāḥ
translated: Those omens are indicated by celestial, atmospheric, and terrestrial events. They are the omens of those.

original: manujānām apacārād aparaktā devatāḥ sṛjanty etān/
analyzed: manujānām apacārāt aparaktāḥ devatāḥ sṛjanti etān
translated: Due to the misconduct of men, the gods create these omens.

original: tatpratighātāya nṛpaḥ śāntiṃ rāṣṭre prayuñjīta//🔽divyaṃ grahaṛkṣavaikṛtam ulkānirghātapavanapariveṣāḥ/
analyzed: tad pratighātāya nṛpaḥ śāntim rāṣṭre prayuñjīta  divyam graha ṛkṣa vaikṛtam ulkā nirghāta pavana pariveṣāḥ
translated: For their prevention, the king should perform peace rituals in the kingdom.🔽Celestial omens are the abnormalities of planets and lunar mansions, meteors, thunder, wind, and haloes.

analyzed: gandharva pura purandara cāpa ādi yat āntarikṣam tat
translated: What is atmospheric is the rainbow, city of Gandharvas, and the bow of Indra, etc.

original: bhaumaṃ carasthirabhavaṃ tatśāntibhir āhataṃ śamam upaiti/
analyzed: bhaumam cara sthira bhavam tad śāntibhiḥ āhatam śamam upaiti
translated: The terrestrial [evil] that affects the moving and unmoving [objects] is removed by the propitiatory rites.

original: nābhasam upaiti mṛdutāṃ śāmyati no divyam ity eke//
analyzed: nābhasam upaiti mṛdu tām śāmyati naḥ divyam iti eke
translated: Some say that the aerial [evil] becomes mild, but not the divine [evil].

analyzed: divyam api śamam upaiti prabhūta kanaka anna go mahī dānaiḥ
translated: The divine [evil] also becomes pacified by the gifts of abundant gold, food, cows, and land.

analyzed: rudra āyatane bhūmau godohāt koṭi homāt ca
translated: On the ground in a Rudra temple, by milking a cow and by a crore oblations.

analyzed: ātma suta kośa vāhana pura dāra purohiteṣu loke ca klokeṣu
translated: In the self, son, treasury, vehicle, city, wife, and priest, and in the people.

original: pākam upayāti daivaṃ parikalpitam aṣṭadhā nṛpateḥ//
analyzed: pākam upayāti daivam parikalpitam aṣṭadhā nṛpateḥ
translated: The calculated divine [evil] of a king becomes eightfold.
The breaking, trembling, sweating, shedding of tears, talking, etc. without any apparent cause.

analyzed: liṅga ārcā āyatanānām nāśāya nareśa deśānām  daivata yātrā śakaṭa akṣa cakra yuga ketu bhaṅga patanāni
translated: Are for the destruction of the liṅgas, images, and temples, and of the people and country.🔽The breaking, falling, and separation of the chariot, axle, wheel, yoke, and banner of the divine procession.

analyzed: samparyāsana sādana saṅga śksaṅgāḥ ca na deśa nṛpa śubha dāḥ
translated: The sitting, lying down, and separation of the chariot, axle, wheel, yoke, and banner of the divine procession.

analyzed: ṛṣi dharma pitṛ brahma prodbhūtam vaikṛtam dvijātīnām
translated: The unusual occurrences among the twice-born caused by the Ṛṣis, Dharma, Pitṛs, and Brahmā.

analyzed: yat rudra lokapāla odbhavam paśūnām aniṣṭam tat
translated: The inauspicious occurrences among the animals caused by Rudra and the Lokapālas.

analyzed: guru sita śanaiścara ottham purodhasām viṣṇu jam ca lokānām
translated: The occurrences among the priests caused by Jupiter, Venus, Saturn, and the occurrences among the people caused by Viṣṇu.

analyzed: skanda viśākha samuttham māṇḍalikānām narendrāṇām
translated: The omens of the Mandala kings are those arising from Skanda and Vishakha.

analyzed: vedavyāse mantriṇi vināyake vaikṛtam camū nāthe
translated: If there are changes in the Veda Vyasa, the minister, Vinayaka, the commander of the army,

original: dhātari saviśvakarmaṇi lokābhāvāya nirdiṣṭam//🔽devakumārakumārīvanitāpreṣyeṣu vaikṛtaṃ yat syāt/
analyzed: dhātari sa viśvakarmaṇi loka abhāvāya nirdiṣṭam  deva kumāra kumārī vanitā preṣyeṣu vaikṛtam yat syāt
translated: and the creator along with Vishvakarma, it is indicated for the destruction of the worlds.🔽The changes that occur in the divine boys, girls, and female servants,

analyzed: tat narapateḥ kumāraka kumārikā strī parijanānām
translated: that is for the prince, princess, women, and attendants.

analyzed: rakṣaḥ piśāca gṛhyakauguhyaka nāgānām evam kā itat eva nirdiṣṭam kā itat
translated: The same is indicated for the Rakshasas, Pishachas, Guhyakas, and Nagas.

original: māsaiś caapy aṣṭābhiḥ sarveṣām eva phalapākaḥ//
analyzed: māsaiḥ ca api aṣṭābhiḥ sarveṣām eva phala pākaḥ
translated: The results of all of them ripen after eight months.

original: buddhvā devavikāraṃ śuciḥ purodhās tryahauṣitaḥ snātaḥ/
analyzed: buddhvā deva vikāram śuciḥ purodhāḥ tri aha uṣitaḥ snātaḥ
translated: Having understood the changes of the gods, the priest, being pure, having stayed for three days, having bathed,

original: snānakusumaanulepanavastrair abhyarcayet pratimām//🔽madhuparkeṇa purodhā bhakṣyairK /bakṣair balibhiś ca vidhivad upatiṣṭhet/
analyzed: snāna kusuma anulepana vastraiḥ abhyarcayet pratimām  madhuparkeṇa purodhāḥ bhakṣyaiḥ ṛkbakṣaiḥ balibhiḥ ca vidhivat upatiṣṭhet
translated: should worship the image with bathing, flowers, unguents, and garments.🔽The priest should serve with Madhuparka, food, edibles, and offerings according to the rules.

original: sthālīpākaṃ juhuyād vidhivan mantraiś ca talliṅgaiḥ//
analyzed: sthālīpākam juhuyāt vidhivat mantraiḥ ca tad liṅgaiḥ
translated: He should offer the Sthalipaka oblation according to the rules and with mantras having that as their subject.

analyzed: iti vibudha vikāre śāntayaḥ sapta rātram
translated: Thus, in the case of changes of the gods, the appeasing rites are for seven nights,

analyzed: dvija vibudha gaṇa arcā gīta nṛtya utsavāḥ ca
translated: with worship of the Brahmins and the groups of gods, and with festivals of singing and dancing.

original: vidhivad avanipālair yaiḥ prayuktā na teṣāṃ🔽bhavati duritapāko dakṣiṇābhiś ca ruddhaḥ//
analyzed: vidhivat avanipālaiḥ yaiḥ prayuktāḥ na teṣām  bhavati durita pākaḥ dakṣiṇābhiḥ ca ruddhaḥ
translated: If the fire is properly offered by the kings,🔽the ripening of their sins is obstructed by the sacrificial fees.

original: rāṣṭre yasyaanagniḥ pradīpyate dīpyate ca naindhanavān/
analyzed: rāṣṭre yasya anagniḥ pradīpyate dīpyate ca na endhanavān
translated: In whose country the fire is not kindled, or is kindled without fuel,

original: manujeśvarasya pīḍā tasya caK /omitted rāṣṭrasya vijñeyā//🔽jalamāṃsaārdrajvalane nṛpativadhaḥ praharaṇe raṇo raudraḥ/🔽sainyagrāmapureṣu ca nāśo vahner bhayaṃ kurute//
analyzed: manuja īśvarasya pīḍā tasya rāṣṭrasya vijñeyā  jala māṃsa ārdra jvalane nṛpati vadhaḥ praharaṇe raṇaḥ raudraḥ  sainya grāma pureṣu ca nāśaḥ vahneḥ bhayam kurute
translated: the lord of men and his country should be known to be afflicted.🔽If the fire burns in water, meat, or wet fuel, there is a terrible battle with weapons,🔽and destruction of the army, village, and city. The fire causes fear.

analyzed: prāsāda bhavana toraṇa ketu ādiṣu an analena dagdheṣu
translated: If palaces, buildings, triumphal arches, flags, etc. are burned by fire,

analyzed: taḍitā vā ṣaṣ māsāt para cakrasya āgamaḥ niyamāt
translated: or struck by lightning, the invasion of a foreign army is certain after six months.

original: dhūmo anagnisamuttho rajas tamaś caahnijaṃ mahābhayadam/
analyzed: dhūmaḥ an agni samutthaḥ rajaḥ tamaḥ ca ahni jam mahā bhaya dam
translated: Smoke arising from non-fire, and dust and darkness arising from the day, cause great fear.

original: vyabhre niśy uḍunāśo darśanam api caahni doṣakaram//
analyzed: vyabhre niśi uḍu nāśaḥ darśanam api ca ahni doṣa karam
translated: In a cloudless night, the destruction of stars, and even their appearance during the day, cause harm.

original: nagaracatuṣpādaṇḍajaK /catuṣpādaaṇḍajamanujānāṃ bhayakaraṃ jvalanam āhuḥ/🔽dhūmaagnivisphuliṅgaiḥ śayyāambarakeśagair mṛtyuḥ//
analyzed: nagara catuṣpād aṇḍaja kcatuṣpāda aṇḍaja manujānām bhaya karam jvalanam āhuḥ  dhūma agni visphuliṅgaiḥ śayyā ambara keśa gaiḥ mṛtyuḥ
translated: They say that fire in the city, quadrupeds, birds, and humans causes fear.🔽By smoke, fire, and sparks, going into the bed, clothes, or hair, there is death.

analyzed: āyudha jvalana sarpaṇa svanāḥ kośa nirgamana vepanāni vā
translated: The sounds of weapons, fire, and crawling, or the trembling of the treasury's exit,

original: vaikṛtāni yadi vāāyudhe aparāṇy āśu raudraraṇasaṅkulaṃ vadet//
analyzed: vaikṛtāni yadi vā āyudhe aparāṇi āśu raudra raṇa saṅkulam vadet
translated: If there are other inauspicious signs in the weapons, it should be said that there will be a terrible and violent battle soon.

analyzed: mantraiḥ āgneyaiḥ kvāhnaiḥ kṣīravṛkṣāt samidbhiḥ
translated: With mantras related to Agni, with the Kâhvâna mantras, with sticks of the Kshira tree,

analyzed: hotavyaḥ agniḥ sarṣapaiḥ sarpiṣā ca
translated: Agni should be offered oblations with mustard seeds and ghee.

analyzed: agni ādīnām vaikṛte śāntiḥ evam
translated: In the case of inauspicious signs of Agni and others, the propitiation should be done in this way.

original: deyaṃ caasmin kāñcanaṃ brāhmaṇebhyaḥ//🔽śākhābhaṅge akasmād vṛkṣāṇāṃ nirdiśed raṇodyogam/
analyzed: deyam ca asmin kāñcanam brāhmaṇebhyaḥ  śākhā bhaṅge akasmāt vṛkṣāṇām nirdiśet raṇa udyogam
translated: And gold should be given to Brahmins in this (rite).🔽If a tree breaks a branch suddenly, it should be predicted that there will be an effort for war.

original: hasane deśabhraṃśaṃ rudite ca vyādhibāhulyam//🔽rāṣṭravibhedas tv anṛtau bālavadho atīva kusumite bāle/🔽vṛkṣāt kṣīrasrāve sarvadravyakṣayo bhavati//
analyzed: hasane deśa bhraṃśam rudite ca vyādhi bāhulyam  rāṣṭra vibhedaḥ tu anṛtau bāla vadhaḥ atīva kusumite bāle  vṛkṣāt kṣīra srāve sarva dravya kṣayaḥ bhavati
translated: If it laughs, there will be loss of country; if it cries, there will be an abundance of diseases.🔽If a tree bleeds milk, it indicates destruction of all wealth.

original: madye vāhananāśaḥ saṃgrāmaḥ śoṇite madhuni rogaḥ/🔽snehe durbhikṣabhayaṃ mahadbhayaṃ niḥsruteK /niḥsṛte salile//
analyzed: madye vāhana nāśaḥ saṃgrāmaḥ śoṇite madhuni rogaḥ  snehe durbhikṣa bhayam mahat bhayam niḥsruta ik niḥsṛte salile
translated: If there is a flow of wine, there will be loss of vehicles; if there is a flow of blood, there will be disease;🔽if there is a flow of oil, there will be great fear of famine; if there is a flow of water,

analyzed: śuṣka virohe vīrya anna saṃkṣayaḥ śoṣaṇe ca virujānām
translated: if a dry tree sprouts, there will be destruction of heroic food; if there is drying up of healthy trees,

original: patitānām utthāne svayaṃ bhayaṃ daivajanitaṃ ca//
analyzed: patitānām utthāne svayam bhayam daiva janitam ca
translated: if fallen trees rise up by themselves, there will be fear from the king and from fate.

original: pūjitavṛkṣe hy anṛtau kusumaphalaṃ nṛpavadhāya nirdiṣṭam/
analyzed: pūjita vṛkṣe hi anṛtau kusuma phalam nṛpa vadhāya nirdiṣṭam
translated: If a worshipped tree blooms or bears fruit out of season, it is predicted to be for the destruction of the king.

original: dhūmas tasmin jvālā atha vā bhaven nṛpavadhāyaeva//
analyzed: dhūmaḥ tasmin jvālā atha vā bhavet nṛpa vadhāya eva
translated: If there is smoke or flame in it, it foretells the death of the king.

original: sarpatsu taruṣu jalpatsu vāapi janasaṃkṣayo vinirdiṣṭaḥ/
analyzed: sarpatsu taruṣu jalpatsu vā api jana saṃkṣayaḥ vinirdiṣṭaḥ
translated: If the trees move or speak, it is declared to be the destruction of people.

analyzed: vṛkṣāṇām vaikṛtye daśabhiḥ māsaiḥ phala vipākaḥ
translated: If there is deformity in the trees, the result will be within ten months.

analyzed: sraj gandha dhūpa ambara pūjitasya chatram vidhāya upari pādapasya
translated: Having placed an umbrella above the tree worshipped with garlands, scents, incense and garments,

original: kṛtvā śivaṃ rudrajapo atra kāryo rudrebhya ity atra ṣaḍ eva homāḥK /ṣaḍaṅgahomaḥ//
analyzed: kṛtvā śivam rudra japaḥ atra kāryaḥ rudrebhyaḥ iti atra ṣaṭ eva homāḥ kṣaḍaṅga homaḥ
translated: the auspicious Rudra recitation should be performed here. In this, there are only six oblations to the Rudras. The oblation to the six limbs.

original: pāyasena madhunāpiK /madhunā ca bhojayed brāhmaṇān ghṛtayutena bhūpatiḥ/
analyzed: pāyasena ca bhojayet brāhmaṇān ghṛta yutena bhūpatiḥ
translated: The king should feed the Brahmins with milk pudding, honey and ghee mixed with honey.

original: medinī nigaditāatra dakṣiṇā vaikṛte tarukṛte hitārthibhiḥ//
analyzed: medinī nigaditā atra dakṣiṇā vaikṛte taru kṛte hita arthibhiḥ
translated: The earth is declared here as the fee, for the benefit of those who perform the rites for the deformed tree.

analyzed: nāle abja yava ādīnām ekasmin dvi tri sambhavaḥ maraṇam
translated: In the case of lotus, barley etc., the birth of one or two in one stalk foretells death.

original: kathayati tadadhipatīnāṃ yamalaṃ jātaṃ ca kusumaphalam//
analyzed: kathayati tad adhipatīnām yamalam jātam ca kusuma phalam
translated: It speaks of the birth of twins among their lords, and the appearance of flowers and fruits.

analyzed: ati vṛddhiḥ sasyānām nānā phala kusuma sambhava ukbhavaḥ vṛkṣe
translated: There is excessive growth of crops, and the appearance of various fruits and flowers in the tree.

original: bhavati hi yady ekasmin paracakrasyaāgamo niyamāt//
analyzed: bhavati hi yadi ekasmin para cakrasya āgamaḥ niyamāt
translated: If it happens in one, the arrival of a foreign army is certain.

original: ardhena yadā tailaṃ bhavati tilānām atailatā vā syāt/
analyzed: ardhena yadā tailam bhavati tilānām a taila tā vā syāt
translated: When oil is half the quantity of sesame seeds, or if there is no oil at all,

original: annasya ca vairasyaṃ tadā tu vindyād bhayaṃ sumahat//
analyzed: annasya ca vairasyam tadā tu vindyāt bhayam su mahat
translated: and if food becomes tasteless, then one should know there is great danger.

original: vikṛtakusumaṃ phalam vā grāmād atha vā purād vahiḥK /ū /bahiḥ kāryam/
analyzed: vikṛta kusumam phalam vā grāmāt atha vā purāt vahiḥkūbahis kāryam
translated: If a flower or fruit is deformed either in the village or outside the city, it should be thrown outside.

original: saumyo atra caruḥ kāryo nirvāpyo vā paśuḥ śāntyai//
analyzed: saumyaḥ atra caruḥ kāryaḥ nirvāpyaḥ vā paśuḥ śāntyai
translated: Here, a Soma oblation should be made or an animal should be offered for peace.

analyzed: sasye ca dṛṣṭvā vikṛtim pradeyam
translated: And when a deformation is seen in crops,

analyzed: tat kṣetram eva prathamam dvijebhyaḥ
translated: that field should first be given to the twice-born.

analyzed: tasya eva madhye carum atra bhaumam
translated: And in the middle of it, here, a Bhauma oblation should be made,

analyzed: kṛtvā na doṣam samupaiti tajjam tajjān
translated: by doing that, one does not incur the fault arising from it.

original: durbhikṣam anāvṛṣṭāv ativṛṣṭauK /anāvṛṣṭyām ativṛṣṭyām kṣudbhayaṃ parabhayaṃ caK /saparacakram/
analyzed: durbhikṣam anāvṛṣṭau ativṛṣṭau kanāvṛṣṭyām ativṛṣṭyām kṣudh bhayam para bhayam caksa para cakram
translated: In a famine, drought, or excessive rain, in drought or excessive rain, there is danger of hunger, danger from enemies, and the enemy's army.

analyzed: rogaḥ hi an ṛtu bhavāyām an abhra jātāyām
translated: In an untimely disease, there is danger to the king. In an untimely death of the king, there is danger to the king.

analyzed: śīta auṣṇa viparyāsa u viparyāse no samyak ṛtuṣu ca sampravṛtteṣu
translated: In a reversal of cold and heat, in a reversal, not in the proper seasons,

analyzed: ṣaṣ māsāt rāṣṭra bhayam roga bhayam daiva janitam ca
translated: after six months, there is danger to the kingdom, danger of disease, and danger caused by fate.

analyzed: anya ṛtau sapta aham prabandha varṣe pradhāna nṛpa maraṇam
translated: In an untimely season, if it rains continuously for seven days, there is the death of the principal king.

analyzed: rakte śastra audyogaḥ māṃsa asthi vasā ādibhiḥ marakaḥ
translated: In case of blood, the enemy may be killed by the use of weapons, or by means of flesh, bones, marrow, etc.

analyzed: dhānya hiraṇya tvac phala kusuma ādyaiḥ varṣitaiḥ bhayam vindyāt
translated: If it rains blood, there is danger from weapons and instruments. If it rains grains, gold, bark, fruits, flowers, etc., one should know that there is fear.

original: aṅgārapāṃśuvarṣe vināśam āyāti tannagaram//🔽upalā vinā jaladharair vikṛtā vā prāṇino yadā vṛṣṭāḥ/
analyzed: aṅgāra pāṃśu varṣe vināśam āyāti tat nagaram  upalāḥ vinā jaladharaiḥ vikṛtāḥ vā prāṇinaḥ yadā vṛṣṭāḥ
translated: If it rains charcoal and dust, that city meets with destruction.🔽If stones or deformed animals are rained down without clouds,

analyzed: chidram vā api ati vṛṣṭau sasyānām īti saṃjananam
translated: or if there is a hole or excessive rain, it causes harm to the crops.

original: K /one verse inserted🔽K / // kṣīraghṛtakṣaudrāṇāṃ dadhno rudhirauṣṇavāriṇāṃK's tr / vāriṇo varṣe/
analyzed: kone vese inserted  kṣīra ghṛta kṣaudrāṇām dadhnaḥ vāriṇas varṣe
translated: One verse inserted🔽In a rain of milk, ghee, honey, curd, blood, hot water,

original: K / // deśavināśo jñeyo asṛgvarṣe ca api nṛpayuddham//
analyzed: deśa vināśaḥ jñeyaḥ asṛj varṣe ca api nṛpa yuddham
translated: one should know that there will be destruction of the country, and in a rain of blood, there will be war between kings.

original: yady amale arke chāyā na dṛśyate pratīpā vā/
analyzed: yadi amale arke chāyā na dṛśyate pratīpā vā
translated: If the shadow of the spotless sun is not seen or is reversed,

analyzed: deśasya tadā su mahat bhayam āyātam vinirdeśyam
translated: then one should predict that a very great danger has come to the country.

original: vyabhre nabhasiindradhanur divā yadā dṛśyate atha vā rātrau/
analyzed: vyabhre nabhasi indradhanuḥ divā yadā dṛśyate atha vā rātrau
translated: If a rainbow is seen in the cloudless sky during the day or at night,

original: prācyām aparasyāṃ vā tadā bhavet kṣudbhyaṃ sumahat//
analyzed: prācyām aparasyām vā tadā bhavet kṣudbhyam su mahat
translated: then there will be a great famine in the east or west.

analyzed: sūrya aindu parjanya samīraṇānām smṛtaḥ vṛṣṭi vikāra kāle
translated: The worship of the sun, moon, clouds, and wind is remembered as causing changes in rainfall.

original: dhānyaannagokāñcanadakṣiṇāś ca deyās tataḥ śāntim upaiti pāpam//
analyzed: dhānya anna go kāñcana dakṣiṇāḥ ca deyāḥ tatas śāntim upaiti pāpam
translated: and gifts of grain, food, cows, gold, and Dakshina should be made. Then the sin is appeased.

original: apasarpaṇaṃ nadīnām nagarād acireṇa śūnyatāṃ kurute/🔽śoṣaś caaśoṣyāṇām anyeṣāṃ vā hradādīnām//
analyzed: apasarpaṇam nadīnām nagarāt acireṇa śūnya tām kurute  śoṣaḥ ca a śoṣyāṇām anyeṣām vā hrada ādīnām
translated: The flowing away of rivers from a city soon makes it empty.🔽And the drying up of un-drying lakes and other water-reservoirs.

analyzed: sneha asṛj māṃsa vahāḥ saṅkula kaluṣāḥ pratīpa gāḥ ca api
translated: The rivers, flowing with oil, blood, flesh, and impurities, and flowing in the opposite direction,

original: paracakrasyaāgamanaṃ nadyaḥ kathayanti ṣaṇmāsāt//🔽jvālādhūmakvāthaāruditautkruṣṭāni caeva kūpānām/🔽gītaprajalpitāni ca janamarakāyaupadiṣṭāniK /pradiṣṭāni//
analyzed: para cakrasya āgamanam nadyaḥ kathayanti ṣaṣ māsāt  jvālā dhūma kvātha ārudita autkruṣṭāni ca eva kūpānām  gīta prajalpitāni ca jana marakāyaupadiṣṭa anikpradiṣṭāni
translated: indicate the approach of an enemy army six months in advance.🔽The flames, smoke, boiling, crying, and shouting of wells,🔽and the singing and whispering of people foretell the death of people.

analyzed: salila ktoya autpattiḥ a khāte gandha rasa viparyaye ca toyānām
translated: The appearance of water in places where it was not before, and the change in the smell and taste of water,

original: salilāśayavikṛtau vā mahadbhayaṃ tatra śantim imāmK /iyam//
analyzed: salilāśaya vikṛtau vā mahat bhayam tatra
translated: or the alteration of water-reservoirs, foretell great danger. For that, this peace-rite should be performed.

original: salilavikāre kuryāt pūjāṃ varuṇasya vāruṇair mantraiḥ/
analyzed: salila vikāre kuryāt pūjām varuṇasya vāruṇaiḥ mantraiḥ
translated: In the disturbance of water, one should worship Varuna with Varuna mantras.

original: tair eva ca japahomaṃ śamam evaṃ pāpam upayāti//
analyzed: taiḥ eva ca japa homam śamam evam pāpam upayāti
translated: And by those very [mantras] one should perform japa and homa. Thus the sin is appeased.

analyzed: prasava vikāre strīṇām dvi tri catuṣprabhṛti samprasūtau vā
translated: In the disturbance of childbirth, if women give birth to two, three, or more children,

analyzed: hīna atirikta kāle ca deśa kula saṃkṣayaḥ bhavati
translated: and if the time is less or more than normal, there will be destruction of the country and family.

analyzed: vaḍavā uṣṭra mahiṣa go hastinīṣu yamala audbhave eṣām
translated: In the case of twins born to a mare, camel, buffalo, cow, or elephant, there is a fight to the death.

original: ṣaṇmāsāt sūtiphalaṃ śāntau ślokau ca gargauktau//
analyzed: ṣaṣ māsāt sūti phalam śāntau ślokau ca garga uktau
translated: If they die, the result of delivery is peace after six months. Two verses were spoken by Garga:

original: nāryaḥ parasya viṣaye tyaktavyās tā hitaarthinā/
analyzed: nāryaḥ parasya viṣaye tyaktavyāḥ tāḥ hita arthinā
translated: A man seeking his own welfare should abandon women in the territory of another.

original: tarpayec ca dvijān kāmaiḥ śāntiṃ caevaatra kārayet//
analyzed: tarpayet ca dvijān kāmaiḥ śāntim ca eva atra kārayet
translated: And he should satisfy the Brahmins with desired objects, and should perform a peace-offering here.

analyzed: catuṣpādāḥ sva yūthebhyaḥ tyaktavyāḥ para bhūmiṣu
translated: Animals with four legs should be abandoned from their own herds in the territories of others.

original: nagaraṃ svāminaṃ yūtham anyathā tu vināśayet//
analyzed: nagaram svāminam yūtham anyathā tu vināśayet
translated: A city, a lord, a herd - otherwise it would be destroyed.

original: parayonāv abhigamanaṃ bhavati tiraścām asādhu dhenūnām/
analyzed: para yonau abhigamanam bhavati tiraścām asādhu dhenūnām
translated: Intercourse with another species occurs among animals, which is not proper for cows.

original: ukṣāṇo vāanyonyaṃ pibati śvā vā surabhiputram//
analyzed: ukṣāṇaḥ vā aanyonyam pibati śvā vā surabhi putram
translated: A bull drinks with another, or a dog with the son of a cow.

analyzed: māsa trayeṇa vindyāt tasmin niḥsaṃśayam para āgamanam
translated: Within three months, one should know that the arrival of another is certain in that case.

analyzed: tad pratighātāya etau ślokau gargeṇa nirdiṣṭau
translated: For the prevention of that, these two verses were indicated by Garga:

original: tyāgo vivāsanaṃ dānaṃ tat tasyaāśu śubhaṃ bhavet/
analyzed: tyāgaḥ vivāsanam dānam tat tasya āśu śubham bhavet
translated: Abandonment, exile, and giving - that would quickly be auspicious for him.

original: tarpayed brāhmaṇāṃś caatra japahomāṃś ca kārayet//
analyzed: tarpayet brāhmaṇān ca atra japa homān ca kārayet
translated: And he should satisfy the Brahmins here, and should perform muttering and oblations.

analyzed: sthālīpākena dhātāram paśunā ca purohitaḥ
translated: The priest with a sacrificial post and an animal,

analyzed: prājāpatyena mantreṇa yajet bahu anna dakṣiṇam
translated: With the mantra of Prajapati, he should worship with abundant food and gifts.

original: yānaṃ vāhaviyuktaṃ yadi gacchen na vrajec ca vāhayutam/
analyzed: yānam vāha viyuktam yadi gacchet na vrajet ca vāha yutam
translated: If a vehicle moves without its yoking animal, or does not move even when yoked,

original: rāṣṭrabhayaṃ bhavati tadā cakrāṇāṃ sādabhaṅge ca//
analyzed: rāṣṭra bhayam bhavati tadā cakrāṇām sāda bhaṅge ca
translated: then there is danger to the kingdom, and if the wheels are damaged.

original: K / // gītaravatūryaśabdā nabhasi yadā vā carasthiraanyatvam/
analyzed: gīta rava tūrya śabdāḥ nabhasi yadā vā cara sthira anya tvam
translated: If the sounds of singing, musical instruments, and drums in the sky are different from before,

original: K / // mṛtyus tadā gadā vā visvatūryeK /ū /visvaratārye paraabhibhavaḥ//
analyzed: mṛtyuḥ tadā gadā vā para abhibhavaḥ
translated: then there is death or a club, or in the case of a discordant musical instrument, defeat by others.

original: K / // anabhihatatūryanādaḥ śabdo vā tāḍiteṣu yadi na syāt/
analyzed: an abhihata tūrya nādaḥ śabdaḥ vā tāḍiteṣu yadi na syāt
translated: If there is no sound from an unstruck musical instrument or from struck ones,

original: K / // vyutpattau vā teṣāṃ paraāgamo nṛpatimaraṇaṃ vā//🔽golāṅgalayoḥ saṅge darvīśūrpaādyupaskaravikāre/
analyzed: vyutpattau vā teṣām para āgamaḥ nṛpati maraṇam vā  go lāṅgalayoḥ saṅge darvī śūrpa ādi upaskara vikāre
translated: then there will be an uprising or the arrival of enemies or the death of the king.🔽In the conjunction of the two signs of Capricorn and Aquarius, if there is a change in the utensils such as the winnowing basket,

original: kroṣṭukanāde ca tathā śastrabhayaṃ munivacaś caidam//
analyzed: kroṣṭuka nāde ca tathā śastra bhayam muni vacaḥ ca edam
translated: and if there is the howling of jackals, then there is the danger of weapons, and this is the sage's statement.

original: vāyavyeṣv eṣu nṛpatir vāyuṃ śaktubhir arcayet/
analyzed: vāyavyeṣu eṣu nṛpatiḥ vāyum śaktubhiḥ arcayet
translated: In these Vayu signs, the king should worship Vayu with flour offerings.

original: āvāyor iti pañcarco japtavyāḥK /jāpyāś ca prayatair dvijaiḥ//
analyzed: ā vāyoḥ iti pañcarcaḥ japtavyāḥ k jāpyāḥ ca prayataiḥ dvijaiḥ
translated: The five verses beginning with O Vayu should be recited by diligent Brahmins.

analyzed: brāhmaṇān parama annena dakṣiṇābhiḥ ca tarpayet
translated: He should satisfy the Brahmins with excellent food and gifts.

analyzed: bahu anna dakṣiṇāḥ homāḥ kartavyāḥ ca prayatnataḥ
translated: and sacrifices with abundant food and gifts should be performed with care.

original: purapakṣiṇo vanacarā vanyā vā nirbhayā viśanti puram/
analyzed: pura pakṣiṇaḥ vana carāḥ vanyāḥ vā nirbhayāḥ viśanti puram
translated: If birds living in cities enter the city fearlessly, or wild birds or animals living in the forest enter the city,

original: naktaṃ vā divasacarāḥ kṣapācarā vā caranty ahani//
analyzed: naktam vā divasa carāḥ kṣapā carāḥ vā caranti ahani
translated: or if nocturnal animals move about during the day, or diurnal animals move about at night,

original: sandhyādvaye api maṇḍalam ābadhnanto mṛgā vihaṅgā vā/
analyzed: sandhyā dvaye api maṇḍalam ābadhnantaḥ mṛgāḥ vihaṅgāḥ vā
translated: or if deer or birds tie their tails at the two twilights,

original: dīptāyāṃ diśy atha vā krośantaḥ saṃhatā bhayadāḥ//
analyzed: dīptāyām diśi atha vā krośantaḥ saṃhatāḥ bhaya dāḥ
translated: or if they cry out when the direction is ablaze, they are fearful when assembled.

original: śyenāḥK /śvānaḥ prarudanta iva dvāre krośanti jambukā dīptāḥ/
analyzed: śyenāḥ kśvānaḥ prarudantaḥ iva dvāre krośanti jambukāḥ dīptāḥ
translated: If hawks, dogs, or jackals cry like weeping at the gate,

original: praviśen narendrabhavane kapotakaḥ kauśiko yadi vā//🔽kukkuṭarutaṃ pradoṣe hemantaādau ca kokilaālāpāḥ/
analyzed: praviśet narendra bhavane kapotakaḥ kauśikaḥ yadi vā  kukkuṭa rutam pradoṣe hemanta ādau ca kokila ālāpāḥ
translated: or if a pigeon or a crow enters the king's palace,🔽if there is the sound of a cock crowing at dusk, or the cooing of cuckoos at the beginning of winter,

analyzed: pratiloma maṇḍala carāḥ śyena ādyāḥ ca ambare bhaya dāḥ
translated: or if hawks and others move in the sky in the opposite direction, they are fearful.

analyzed: gṛha caitya toraṇeṣu dvāreṣu ca pakṣi saṅgha sampāta ḍhak sampātāḥ
translated: The flocking of birds to the household shrines, arches, and gates,

analyzed: madhu valmīka ambhoruha samudbhava śc samudbhavāḥ ca api nāśāya
translated: and the emergence of honey, anthills, and lotuses are also for destruction.

analyzed: śvabhiḥ asthi śava avayava praveśanam mandireṣu marakāya
translated: If dogs enter the houses with bones and dead bodies, it is for destruction.

analyzed: paśu śastra vyāhāre nṛpa mṛtyuḥ muni vacaḥ ca edam
translated: In the case of the utterance of the words Pashu and Shastra, the death of the king, and this is the statement of the sage.

analyzed: mṛga pakṣi vikāreṣu kuryāt dhīmān kūdhomān sa dakṣiṇān
translated: In the case of changes in deer and birds, the wise one should perform sacrifices with Dakshina.

original: devāḥ kapota iti ca japtavyāḥ pañcabhir dvijaiḥ//
analyzed: devāḥ kapotaḥ iti ca japtavyāḥ pañcabhiḥ dvijaiḥ
translated: The gods should be recited by five Brahmins with the words Kapota.

original: sudevā iti caekena deyā gāvaḥ sadakṣiṇāḥK /ca dakṣiṇā/
analyzed: sudevāḥ iti ca ekena deyāḥ gāvaḥ sa dakṣiṇāḥ ca dakṣiṇā
translated: And by one with the words Sudeva, cows should be given with Dakshina.

analyzed: japet śākuna sūktam vā manaḥ ca
translated: One should recite the Shakunasukta or the Manasa Veda-shira.

analyzed: śakra dhvaja aindra kīla stambha dvāra prapāta bhaṅgeṣu
translated: In the case of the breaking of Shakra-dhvaja, Indra-kila, pillar, gate, and rampart,

original: tadvat kapāṭatoraṇaketūnāṃ narapater maraṇam//🔽sandhyādvayasya dīptir dhūmautpattiś ca kānane anagnau/
analyzed: tadvat kapāṭa toraṇa ketūnām narapateḥ maraṇam  sandhyā dvayasya dīptiḥ dhūma autpattiḥ ca kānane anagnau
translated: similarly of the doors, arches, and banners, there is death of the king.🔽The appearance of two twilights, the rise of smoke in the forest without fire,

original: chidraabhāve bhūmer daraṇaṃ kampaś ca bhayakārī//
analyzed: chidra abhāve bhūmeḥ daraṇam kampaḥ ca bhaya kārī
translated: and the trembling of the earth without a hole are fearful.

analyzed: nāstikānām ca bhaktaḥ
translated: Devoted to heretics, infidels,🔽abandoned by good conduct, of an angry disposition,

analyzed: īrṣyuḥ krūraḥ vigraha āsakta cetāḥ
translated: envious, cruel, and attached to quarrels -

analyzed: yasmin rājā tasya deśasya nāśaḥ
translated: in whose country the king is, that country is destroyed.

original: prahara hara chindhi bhindhiity āyudhakāṣṭhaaśmapāṇayo bālāḥ/
analyzed: prahara hara chindhi bhindhi iti āyudha kāṣṭha aśma pāṇayaḥ bālāḥ
translated: Boys with weapons, wood, or stones in their hands, shouting Strike! Cut! Break!

original: nigadantaḥ praharante tatraapi bhayaṃ bhavaty āśu//
analyzed: nigadantaḥ praharante tatra api bhayam bhavati āśu
translated: Even when they are not seen, they speak and strike, and fear arises quickly.

analyzed: aṅgāragairika ādyaiḥ vikṛta preta abhilekhanam yasmin
translated: In a place where deformed ghosts are drawn with charcoal, red chalk, etc.,

original: nāyakacitritam atha vā kṣaye kṣayaṃ yāti na cireṇa//🔽lūtāpaṭaaṅgaśabalaṃ na sandhyayoḥ pūjitaṃ kalahayuktam/
analyzed: nāyaka citritam atha vā kṣaye kṣayam yāti na cireṇa  lūtā paṭa aṅga śabalam na sandhyayoḥ pūjitam kalaha yuktam
translated: or where the leader is depicted, it quickly perishes and is destroyed.🔽A house that is variegated with spider webs and strings, not worshipped at dusk and dawn, full of quarrels,

original: nityaucchiṣṭastrīkaṃ ca yad gṛhaṃ tat kṣayaṃ yāti//
analyzed: nitya aucchiṣṭa strīkam ca yat gṛham tat kṣayam yāti
translated: and where women always leave food on their plates, that house perishes.

original: dṛṣṭeṣu yātudhāneṣu nirdiśen marakam āśu samprāptam/
analyzed: dṛṣṭeṣu yātudhāneṣu nirdiśet marakam āśu samprāptam
translated: When demons are seen, one should quickly point out the impending calamity.

analyzed: pratighātāya eteṣām gargaḥ śāntim cakāra emām
translated: For the destruction of these, Garga composed this peace offering.

original: mahāśāntyo atha balayo bhojyāni sumahānti ca/
analyzed: mahā śāntyaḥ atha balayaḥ bhojyāni su mahānti ca
translated: Then there are the great peace offerings, and the great feasts,

original: kārayeta mahendraṃ ca māhendrīṃK /mahendrībhiḥ ca samarcayet//
analyzed: kārayeta mahendram ca ca samarcayet
translated: and one should make the great Indra offering, and worship with the great Indra offerings.

original: narapatideśavināśe ketor udaye atha vā grahe arkendvoḥ/
analyzed: narapati deśa vināśe ketoḥ udaye atha vā grahe arka indvoḥ
translated: In the destruction of the king and the country, at the rise of Ketu, or of the sun and moon,

analyzed: utpātānām prabhavaḥ sva ṛtu bhavaḥ ca api adoṣāya
translated: the appearance of portents is from their own season, and that is without fault.

original: ye ca na doṣān janayanty utpātās tān ṛtusvabhāvakṛtān/
analyzed: ye ca na doṣān janayanti utpātāḥ tān ṛtu svabhāva kṛtān
translated: And those portents that do not produce faults, they are from the nature of the season.

analyzed: ṛṣi putra kṛtaiḥ ślokaiḥ vidyāt etaiḥ samāsa uktaiḥ
translated: One should know them by these verses composed by the son of a sage, stated in brief.

analyzed: vajra aśani mahīkampa sandhyā nirghāta niḥsvanāḥ
translated: The sounds of thunder, lightning, earthquakes, twilight, and hurricanes,

analyzed: pariveṣa rajaḥ dhūma rakta arka astamayaka stamana audayāḥ
translated: The halo around the sun, dust, smoke, the sun and moon appearing red, and the sun and moon setting or rising at unusual times,

analyzed: drumebhyaḥ anna rasa sneha bahu puṣpa phala odgamāḥ
translated: The appearance of food, juices, oils, many flowers and fruits from trees,

analyzed: go pakṣi mada vṛddhiḥ ca śivāya madhu mādhave
translated: And the increase in the rutting of elephants and birds, are auspicious for the spring season.🔽The appearance of stars, meteors, and the sun and moon's halo being reddish-brown,🔽The spontaneous burning, bursting, and smoke-like dust being struck by the wind,

analyzed: rakta padma aruṇa akaruṇam sandhyāksandhyam nabhaḥ kṣubdha arṇava aupamam
translated: The sky being red like a red lotus or reddish-brown at twilight, resembling a turbulent ocean,

original: saritāṃ caambusaṃśoṣaṃ dṛṣṭvā grīṣme śubhaṃ vadet//🔽śakrāyudhaparīveṣavidyutśuṣkavirohaṇam/🔽kampaudvartanavaikṛtyaṃ rasanaṃ daraṇaṃ kṣiteḥ//
analyzed: saritām ca ambu saṃśoṣam dṛṣṭvā grīṣme śubham vadet  śakrāyudha parīveṣa vidyut śuṣka virohaṇam  kampa audvartana vaikṛtyam rasanam daraṇam kṣiteḥ
translated: And seeing the drying up of the water in rivers during the summer, one should speak of it as auspicious.🔽The appearance of rainbows, lightning, and the sprouting of dry trees,🔽The trembling, shaking, and deformation of the earth, and the splitting of the earth,

analyzed: saraḥ nadī udapānānām vṛddhi ūrdhva taraṇa plavāḥ
translated: The increase in the water of lakes, rivers, and wells, the floating of things on the water,

analyzed: saraṇam ca adri gehānām varṣāsu na bhaya āvaham  divya strī bhūta gandharva vimāna adbhuta darśanam
translated: And the movement of mountains and houses during the rainy season, are not fearful.🔽The appearance of divine women, spirits, and celestial chariots,

analyzed: graha nakṣatra tārāṇām darśanam ca divā ambare
translated: And the appearance of planets, stars, and constellations in the sky during the day,

analyzed: gīta vāditra nirghoṣāḥ vana parvata sānuṣu
translated: The sounds of singing and musical instruments in the forests, mountains and plateaus,

original: sasyavṛddhir apāṃ hānir apāpāḥ śaradi smṛtāḥ//🔽śītaanilatuṣāratvaṃ nardanaṃ mṛgapakṣiṇām/
analyzed: sasya vṛddhiḥ apām hāniḥ apāpāḥ śaradi smṛtāḥ  śīta anila tuṣāra tvam nardanam mṛga pakṣiṇām
translated: The growth of crops and the decrease of water are considered auspicious in autumn.🔽The cold, wind and frost, the roaring of animals and birds,

analyzed: rakṣaḥ yakṣa ādi sattvānām darśanam vāc amanuṣī
translated: The appearance of demons, yakshas and other beings, and the voices of non-human beings,

analyzed: diśaḥ dhūma andhakārāḥ ca sa nabhaḥ vana parvatāḥ
translated: The sky, atmosphere and mountains covered with smoke and darkness,

original: uccaiḥ sūryaudayaastau ca hemante śobhanāḥ smṛtāḥ//🔽himapātaanilautpātā virūpaadbhutadarśanam/
analyzed: uccais sūrya audaya astau ca hemante śobhanāḥ smṛtāḥ
translated: The high sun rising and setting in winter are considered auspicious.🔽The fall of snow, the rise of wind, the appearance of strange and wonderful things,

analyzed: kṛṣṇa añjana ābham ākāśam tārā ulkā pāta piñjaram
translated: The sky appearing like black collyrium, with stars and meteors falling and turning yellow,

analyzed: citragarbha odbhavāḥ strīṣu go aja aśva mṛga pakṣiṣu
translated: The birth of variegated offspring among women, cows, goats, horses, deer, birds,

analyzed: patra aṅkura latānām ca vikārāḥ śiśire śubhāḥ
translated: And the changes in leaves, sprouts and vines are auspicious in winter.

original: ṛtusvabhāvajā hy ete dṛṣṭāḥ svaṛtau śubhapradāḥ/
analyzed: ṛtu svabhāva jāḥ hi ete dṛṣṭāḥ sva ṛtau śubha pradāḥ
translated: These are natural to the seasons and, when seen in their own season, bring good fortune.

original: ṛtor anyatra cautpātā dṛṣṭās te caatidāruṇāḥK /bṛśadārunāḥ//
analyzed: ṛtoḥ anyatra ca autpātāḥ dṛṣṭāḥ te ca ati dāruṇāḥ kbṛśa dāruṇāḥ
translated: But when seen outside of the season, they are considered extremely terrible portents.🔽The songs of the insane, the talk of children,

original: unmattānāṃ ca yā gāthāḥ śiśūnāṃ yac ca bhāṣitamK /bhāṣitaṃ ca yat/🔽striyo yac ca prabhāṣante tasya nāsti vyatikramaḥ//
analyzed: unmattānām ca yāḥ gāthāḥ śiśūnām yat ca bhāṣitam 🔽striyaḥ yat ca prabhāṣante tasya na asti vyatikramaḥ
translated: And what women say - these are beyond reproach.

original: pūrvaṃ carati deveṣu paścāc caratiK /gacchati mānuṣān/
analyzed: pūrvam carati deveṣu paścāt caratikgacchati mānuṣān
translated: First it moves among the gods, then it moves among humans.

original: naacoditā vāg vadati satyā hy eṣā sarasvatī//🔽utpātān gaṇitavivarjito api buddhvā
analyzed: na a coditā vāc vadati satyā hi eṣā sarasvatī  utpātān gaṇita vivarjitaḥ api buddhvā
translated: The unprompted speech speaks the truth, for this is the true Sarasvatī.🔽Even without knowing astrology, one becomes famous and beloved by the king

analyzed: vikhyātaḥ bhavati narendra vallabhaḥ ca
translated: by knowing the portents.

analyzed: etat tat muni vacanam rahasyam uktam
translated: This is the secret teaching of the sages,

analyzed: yat jñātvā bhavati naraḥ tri kāla darśī
translated: knowing which a man becomes one who sees the three times.

analyzed: mayūracitraka adhyāyaḥ
translated: The Chapter on the Peacock and the Colorful

original: divyaāntarikṣaāśrayam uktam ādau mayā phalaṃ śastam aśobhanaṃ ca/
analyzed: divya āntarikṣa āśrayam uktam ādau mayā phalam śastam aśobhanam ca
translated: I have first described the results of the heavenly and atmospheric [omens] as auspicious and inauspicious.

original: prāyeṇa cāreṣu samāgameṣu yuddheṣu mārgaādiṣu vistareṇa//🔽bhūyo varāhamihirasya na yuktam etat
analyzed: prāyeṇa cāreṣu samāgameṣu yuddheṣu mārga ādiṣu vistareṇa  bhūyas varāhamihirasya na yuktam etat
translated: And in detail in the movements, meetings, battles, roads, and so on.

original: kartuṃ samāsakṛd asav iti tasya doṣaḥ/
analyzed: kartum samāsakṛt asau iti tasya doṣaḥ
translated: It is not proper for Varāhamihira to do this again and again, so that is his fault.

analyzed: tad jñaiḥ na vācyam idam ukta phala anugī iti
translated: This should not be spoken by the wise, as it is a repetition of the results already stated,

analyzed: yat barhikvarhicitrakam iti prathitam varāṅgam
translated: which is well-known as the excellent Varhi-varhi-citraka.
That is its very nature, which is praised and repeated.

original: bravīmy ahaṃ na ced idaṃ tathā api me atra vācyatā//
analyzed: bravīmi aham na ced idam tathā api me atra vācya tā
translated: I speak, if this is not so, then I should be spoken to here.

analyzed: uttara vīthi gatāḥ dyutimantaḥ samastāḥ
translated: The brilliant [planets] moving in the northern path bring prosperity, well-being, and good harvests to all.

analyzed: dakṣiṇa mārga gatāḥ dyuti hīnāḥ kṣudh bhaya taskara mṛtyu karāḥ te
translated: The lustreless [planets] moving in the southern path bring famine, fear, thieves, and death.

original: koṣṭhāgāragate bhṛguputre puṣyasthe ca girām prabhaviṣṇau/
analyzed: koṣṭhāgāra gate bhṛguputre puṣya sthe ca girām prabhaviṣṇau
translated: When Bṛhaspati, the lord of speech, is in the treasury house, in the Puṣya constellation,

original: nirvairāḥ kṣitipāḥ sukhabhājaḥ saṃhṛṣṭāś ca janā gatarogāḥ//
analyzed: nirvairāḥ kṣitipāḥ sukha bhājaḥ saṃhṛṣṭāḥ ca janāḥ gata rogāḥ
translated: the kings are free from enmity, enjoy happiness, and the people are delighted and free from disease.

original: pīḍayanti yadi kṛttikāṃ maghāṃ rohiṇīṃ śravam aindram eva vā/
analyzed: pīḍayanti yadi kṛttikām maghām rohiṇīm śravam aindram eva vā
translated: If [the planets] afflict Kṛttikā, Maghā, Rohiṇī, Śravaṇa, or Indra's [constellation],

original: projjhya sūryam apare grahās tadā paścimā dig anayena pīḍyate//
analyzed: projjhya sūryam apare grahāḥ tadā paścimā diś anayena pīḍyate
translated: and the other planets abandon the sun, then the western direction is afflicted by injustice.

analyzed: prācyām ced dhvaja vat avasthitā dina ante
translated: If [the planets] are situated like a banner in the east at the end of the day,

analyzed: prācyānām bhavati hi vigrahaḥ nṛpāṇām
translated: there is a war between the kings of the east.

analyzed: madhye ced bhavati hi madhyadeśa pīṭha ākūpīḍā
translated: If [they are] in the middle, there is affliction of the people of the central region.

original: rūkṣais tair na tu rucimanK /rucirair mayūkhavadbhiḥ//
analyzed: rūkṣaiḥ taiḥ na tu ruciman kruciraiḥ mayūkhavadbhiḥ
translated: But not by those rough ones, but by the charming ones, like the rays.

original: dakṣiṇāṃ kakubham āśritasK /āśritais tu tair dakṣiṇāpathapayomucāṃ kṣayaḥ/
analyzed: dakṣiṇām kakubham tu taiḥ dakṣiṇāpatha payomucām kṣayaḥ
translated: But if [they are] resorted to by those [planets] that have resorted to the southern direction, there is destruction of the rain clouds of the southern path.

analyzed: hīna rūkṣa tanubhiḥ ca vigrahaḥ sthūla deha kiraṇa anvitaiḥ śubham
translated: And war with those of inferior and rough bodies, and good fortune with those endowed with thick bodies and rays.

original: uttaramārge spaṣṭamayūkhāḥ śāntikarās te tan nṛpatīnām/
analyzed: uttara mārge spaṣṭa mayūkhāḥ śānti karāḥ te tat nṛpatīnām
translated: The clear rays on the northern path are pacifying to those kings.

analyzed: hrasva śarīrāḥ bhasma savarṇāḥ doṣa karāḥ syuḥ deśa nṛpāṇām
translated: The short-bodied ones, the color of ashes, will be harmful to the regional kings.

analyzed: nakṣatrāṇām tārakāḥ sa grahāṇām
translated: If the stars, the planets,

analyzed: dhūma jvālā visphuliṅga anvitāḥ ced
translated: are accompanied by smoke, flames, and sparks,

analyzed: ālokam vā nirnimittam na yānti
translated: or if the light does not go out without cause,

analyzed: yāti dhvaṃsam sarva lokaḥ sa bhūpaḥ
translated: then the whole world, with its kings, is destroyed.

analyzed: divi bhāti yadā tuhina aṃśu yugam
translated: When the pair of moon-rays shines in the sky,

analyzed: dvija vṛddhiḥ atīva tadā āśu śubhā
translated: then the increase of Brahmins is extremely auspicious.

analyzed: tad anantara varṇa raṇaḥ arka yuge
translated: After that, in the pair of Sun-years,

analyzed: jagataḥ pralayaḥ tri catuṣprabhṛti
translated: the destruction of the world begins with three or four.

original: munīn abhijitaṃ dhruvaṃ maghavataś ca bhaṃ saṃspṛśan
analyzed: munīn abhijitam dhruvam maghavataḥ ca bham saṃspṛśan
translated: The comet, which touches the sages, Abhijit, Dhruva, Maghavat, and Bhanu,
destroys the clouds, performs great auspicious deeds, and brings grief.

original: bhujaṅgamK /bhujaṅgabham atha saṃspṛśed bhavati vṛṣṭināśo dhruvaṃ🔽kṣayaṃ vrajati vidruto janapadaś ca bālākulaḥ//
analyzed: atha saṃspṛśet bhavati vṛṣṭi nāśaḥ dhruvam  kṣayam vrajati vidrutaḥ janapadaḥ ca bāla ākulaḥ
translated: Then, if it touches the serpent, the serpent's head, there is certainly destruction of rain,🔽and the country flees in fear, with its people frightened.

original: prāgdvāreṣu caran raviputro nakṣatreṣu karoti ca vakram/
analyzed: prāc dvāreṣu caran ravi putraḥ nakṣatreṣu karoti ca vakram
translated: Moving in the eastern doors, the son of the Sun, in the lunar mansions, makes a retrograde motion.

original: durbhikṣaṃ kurute mahadugraṃK /bhayam ugraṃ mitrāṇāṃ ca virodham avṛṣṭim//
analyzed: durbhikṣam kurute mahat ugram bhayam ugram mitrāṇām ca virodham avṛṣṭim
translated: It makes a great and fierce famine, fierce fear, enmity with friends, and drought.

original: rohiṇīśakaṭam arkanandano yadi bhinatti rudhiro atha vā śikhī/
analyzed: rohiṇīśakaṭam arkanandanaḥ yadi bhinatti rudhiraḥ atha vā śikhī
translated: If the moon's chariot is shattered by Rahu or the comet,

original: kiṃ vadāmi yad aniṣṭasāgare jagad aśeṣam upayāti saṃkṣayam//
analyzed: kim vadāmi yat aniṣṭa sāgare jagat aśeṣam upayāti saṃkṣayam
translated: what can I say, when the entire world is heading towards destruction in the ocean of misfortune?

original: udayati satataṃ yadā śikhī carati bhacakram aśeṣam eva vā/
analyzed: udayati satatam yadā śikhī carati bha cakram aśeṣam eva vā
translated: When the comet rises constantly or moves through the entire zodiac,

original: anubhavati purākṛtaṃ tadā phalam aśubhaṃ sacaraacaraṃ jagat//
analyzed: anubhavati purā kṛtam tadā phalam aśubham sa cara acaram jagat
translated: then the world with its moving and unmoving beings experiences the fruits of past evil deeds.

analyzed: dhanuḥ sthāyī rūkṣaḥ rudhira sadṛśaḥ kṣudh bhaya karaḥ
translated: The comet, standing in the zodiac, rough, blood-like, causing fear of hunger,

original: balodyogaṃ candraḥK /cenduḥ kathayati jayaṃ jyā asya ca yataḥ/
analyzed: bala udyogam kathayati jayam jyā asya ca yatas
translated: the moon indicates the exertion of strength, victory, and the bowstring of the comet.

original: gavāṃavāk śṛṅgo goghno nidhanam api sasyasya kurute
analyzed: gavām avāk śṛṅgaḥ go ghnaḥ nidhanam api sasyasya kurute
translated: The comet, with its head downwards, destroys cows and even brings about the destruction of crops.

analyzed: jvalan dhūmāyan vā nṛpati maraṇāya eva bhavati
translated: Burning or smoking, it leads only to the death of the king.

original: snigdhaḥ sthūlaḥ samaśṛṅgo viśālas tuṅgaś caudagvicaran nāgavīthyām/
analyzed: snigdhaḥ sthūlaḥ sama śṛṅgaḥ viśālaḥ tuṅgaḥ ca audak vicaran nāga vīthyām
translated: Smooth, thick, with even horns, large, tall, moving in the northern direction in the path of the elephant,

original: dṛṣṭaḥ saumyair aśubhair viprayukto lokānandaṃ kurute atīva candraḥ//
analyzed: dṛṣṭaḥ saumyaiḥ aśubhaiḥ viprayuktaḥ loka ānandam kurute atīva candraḥ
translated: seen devoid of inauspicious things by the gentle ones, the moon brings great joy to the world.

analyzed: pitrya maitra puruhūta viśākhā tvāṣṭram etya ca yunakti śaśāṅkaḥ
translated: The moon, having gone to the Pitri, Maitra, Puruhuta, Visakha, and Tvashtri [lunar mansions], joins [the sun].

original: dakṣiṇena na śubhaḥ śubhakṛtK /śubho hitakṛt syād yady udak carati madhyagato vā//
analyzed: dakṣiṇena na śubhaḥ śubha kṛt kśubhaḥ hita kṛt syāt yadi udak carati madhya gataḥ vā
translated: When it moves to the south, it is not auspicious; when it makes auspicious [movements], it would be auspicious if it moves to the north or is in the middle.

original: parigha iti megharekhā yā tiryagbhāskarodaye aste vā/
analyzed: parighe iti megha rekhā yā tiryak bhāskara udaye aste vā
translated: The Pariघa is the line of clouds that appears obliquely at sunrise or sunset.

original: paridhis tu pratisūryo daṇḍas tv ṛjur indracāpanibhaḥ//
analyzed: paridhiḥ tu pratisūryaḥ daṇḍaḥ tu ṛjuḥ indracāpa nibhaḥ
translated: The PariDHi is the reflection of the sun, the staff is straight like a rainbow.

original: udaye aste vā bhānor ye dīrghā raśmayas tv amoghās te/🔽suracāpakhaṇḍam ṛju yad rohitam airāvataṃ dīrgham//🔽ardhaastamayāt sandhyā vyaktībhūtā na tārakā yāvat/
analyzed: udaye aste vā bhānoḥ ye dīrghāḥ raśmayaḥ tu amoghāḥ te  sura cāpa khaṇḍam ṛju yat rohitam airāvatam dīrgham  ardha astamayāt sandhyā vyaktībhūtā na tārakāḥ yāvat
translated: The long rays of the sun at sunrise or sunset are infallible.🔽The red straight part of the rainbow is the AirAvatam, the long [part].🔽From half-sunset, the twilight becomes distinct, as long as the stars are not visible.

analyzed: tejaḥ parihāni mukhāt bhānoḥ ardha odayaḥ yāvat
translated: From the time the light diminishes from the sun's face, until half-sunrise.

original: tasmin sandhyākāle cihnair etaiḥ śubhaaśubhaṃ vācyam/
analyzed: tasmin sandhyā kāle cihnaiḥ etaiḥ śubha aśubham vācyam
translated: In that twilight time, auspicious or inauspicious [omens] should be declared by these signs.

original: sarvair etaiḥ snigdhaiḥ sadyo varṣaṃ bhayaṃ rūkṣaiḥ//
analyzed: sarvaiḥ etaiḥ snigdhaiḥ sadyas varṣam bhayam rūkṣaiḥ
translated: If all these are moist, there will be rain immediately; if dry, there is danger.

original: acchinnaḥ parigho viyac ca vimalaṃ śyāmā mayūkhā raveḥ
analyzed: acchinnaḥ parighaḥ viyat ca vimalam śyāmāḥ mayūkhāḥ raveḥ
translated: The Pariघa is unbroken, the sky is clear, the sun's rays are dark,

original: snigdhā dīdhitayaḥ mitaṃK /ū /sitaṃ suradhanurvidyuc ca pūrvottarā/
analyzed: snigdhāḥ dīdhitayaḥ mitaṃkūsitam suradhanuḥ vidyut ca pūrva uttarā
translated: the sun's rays are moist, the rainbow is white and short, and lightning is in the northeast.

original: snigdho meghatarur divākarakarair āliṅgato vā yadā
analyzed: snigdhaḥ meghataruḥ divākara karaiḥ āliṅgataḥ vā yadā
translated: If a cloud is embraced by the rays of the sun during the day,

original: vṛṣṭiḥ syād yadi vā arkam astasamaye megho mahān chādayet//
analyzed: vṛṣṭiḥ syāt yadi vai arkam asta samaye meghaḥ mahān chādayet
translated: or if there is rain, or if a great cloud covers the sun at sunset,

original: khaṇḍo vakraḥ kṛṣṇo hrasvaḥ kākaādyair vā cihnair viddhaḥ/
analyzed: khaṇḍaḥ vakraḥ kṛṣṇaḥ hrasvaḥ kāka ādyaiḥ vā cihnaiḥ viddhaḥ
translated: if it is fragmented, crooked, black, short, or pierced by signs such as crows,

original: yasmin deśe rūkṣaś cārkas tatrābhāvaḥ prāyo rājñaḥ//
analyzed: yasmin deśe rūkṣaḥ ca arkaḥ tatra abhāvaḥ prāyas rājñaḥ
translated: and if the sun is rough in that country, then there is usually no king there.

original: vāhinīṃ samupayāti pṛṣṭhato māṃsabhuk khagagaṇo yuyutsataḥ/
analyzed: vāhinīm samupayāti pṛṣṭhatas māṃsa bhuj khaga gaṇaḥ yuyutsataḥ
translated: If a flock of meat-eating birds approaches from behind one who is about to fight,

original: yasya tasya balavidravo mahān agrais tu vijayo vihaṅgamaiḥ//
analyzed: yasya tasya bala vidravaḥ mahān agraiḥ tu vijayaḥ vihaṅgamaiḥ
translated: for him there is a great flight of his army, but victory with the vanguard if there are birds.

original: bhānor udaye yadi vāstamaye gandharvapurapratimā dhvajanī/
analyzed: bhānoḥ udaye yadi vā astamaye gandharva pura pratimā dhvajanī
translated: If the city of the Gandharvas, the banner, obstructs the orb of the sun at sunrise or sunset,

original: vimbaṃ niruṇaddhi tadā nṛpateḥ prāptaṃ samaraṃ sabhayaṃ pravadet//
analyzed: vimbam niruṇaddhi tadā nṛpateḥ prāptam samaram sa bhayam pravadet
translated: then one should declare that the king has encountered a dangerous battle.

original: śastā śāntidvijamṛgaghuṣṭā sandhyā snigdhā mṛdupavanā ca/
analyzed: śastā śānti dvija mṛga ghuṣṭā sandhyā snigdhā mṛdu pavanā ca
translated: A peaceful evening is auspicious, resounding with the cries of birds and deer, gentle, with a soft breeze.

original: pāṃśudhvastā janapadanāśaṃ dhatte rūkṣā rudhiranibhā vā//
analyzed: pāṃśu dhvastā janapada nāśam dhatte rūkṣā rudhira nibhā vā
translated: If it is dusty, it portends destruction of the people, if rough, it is like blood.

analyzed: yad vistareṇa kathitam munibhiḥ tat asmin
translated: All that has been extensively described by the sages,

analyzed: sarvam mayā nigaditam punarukta varjam
translated: I have stated it all here, avoiding repetition.

analyzed: śrutvā api kokila rutam balibhuj virauti
translated: Even hearing the cuckoo's song, the crow cries out,

original: yattat svabhāvakṛtam asya pikaṃ na jetum//
analyzed: yat tat svabhāva kṛtam asya pikam na jetum
translated: For it is by nature unable to rival the cuckoo.

analyzed: puṣya snāna adhyāyaḥ
translated: The Chapter on Auspicious Bathing

analyzed: mūlam manuja adhipatiḥ prajā taroḥ tat upaghāta saṃskārāt
translated: The king is the root of the people's prosperity and downfall.

original: aśubhaṃ śubhaṃ ca loke bhavati yato ato nṛpaticintā//
analyzed: aśubham śubham ca loke bhavati yatas atas nṛpati cintā
translated: Therefore, the king's thoughts are about what is inauspicious and auspicious in the world.

original: yā vyākhyātā śāntiḥ svayambhuvā suraguror mahendraarthe/
analyzed: yā vyākhyātā śāntiḥ svayambhuvā suraguroḥ mahā indra arthe
translated: The peace that was explained by the Self-Existent One for the sake of the great Indra, the preceptor of the gods,

original: tāṃ prāpya vṛddhagargaḥ prāha yathā bhāgureḥ śṛṇuta//
analyzed: tām prāpya vṛddha gargaḥ prāha yathā bhāgureḥ śṛṇuta
translated: Having attained that, Vṛddhagargā said as heard from Bhāgurī. Listen!

analyzed: puṣya snānam nṛpateḥ kartavyam daiva vid purodhābhyām
translated: The king should perform the Puṣya bath with the help of an astrologer and a priest.

analyzed: na atas param pavitram sarva autpāta anta karam asti  śleṣmātaka akṣa kaṇṭaki kaṭu tikta vigandhi pādapa vihīne
translated: There is nothing more sacred than this, which destroys all portents.🔽In a place devoid of trees with slimy, thorny, pungent, bitter, and foul-smelling leaves,

analyzed: kauśika gṛdhra prabhṛtibhiḥ aniṣṭa vihagaiḥ parityakte  taruṇa taru gulma vallī latā pratāna anvita ikāvṛte vana uddeśe
translated: Abandoned by inauspicious birds such as owls and vultures,🔽In a forest area covered with young trees, shrubs, creepers, vines, and branches,

analyzed: nirupahata patra pallava manojña madhura druma prāye
translated: In a place full of trees with beautiful and sweet leaves and sprouts that are not damaged,

analyzed: kṛkavāku jīva jīvaka śuka śikhi śatapattra cāṣa hārītaiḥ
translated: With the sounds of peacocks, partridges, parrots, cuckoos, pigeons, and sparrows,

analyzed: krakara cakora kapiñjala vañjula pārāvata śrīkaiḥ
translated: With the beauty of sparrows, partridges, parrots, bamboo-creepers, and pigeons,

analyzed: kusuma rasa pāna matta dvirepha puṃskokila ādibhiḥ ca anyaiḥ
translated: With the sweet sounds of parrots, sparrows, partridges, cuckoos, and the humming of bees intoxicated by drinking flower nectar, and with other such sounds.

original: virute vanopakaṇṭhe kṣetraāgāre śucāv atha vā//🔽hṛdinīK /ū /hradinīvilāsinīnāṃ jalakhaganakhavikṣateṣu ramyeṣu/🔽pulinajaghaneṣu kuryād dṛkmanasoḥ prītijananeṣu//
analyzed: virute vana upakaṇṭhe kṣetraāgāre śucau atha vā  hṛdinī kūhradinī vilāsinīnām jala khaga nakha vikṣateṣu ramyeṣu  pulina jaghaneṣu kuryāt dṛś manasoḥ prīti jananeṣu
translated: In a forest nearby, in a clean field house, or in a pure place,🔽On beautiful sandbanks, which are charming with the scratches of the claws of water birds,🔽Where the eyes and mind are delighted,

analyzed: protpluta haṃsa chatre kāraṇḍava kura rasa ārasa audgīte
translated: Where the swans are like umbrellas, and the Karandavas, Kuras, and Sarasas sing sweetly,

analyzed: phulla aindīvara nayane sarasi sahasrākṣa kānti dhare  protphulla kamala vadanāḥ kalahaṃsa kalakkala svana prabhāṣiṇyaḥ  prottuṅga kuḍmala kucāḥ yasmin nalinī vilāsinyaḥ
translated: In a lake with eyes like blooming blue lotuses, and the beauty of a thousand eyes,🔽Where the lotus-faced women of the lake speak with the sweet sounds of the Kalakuta birds,🔽And their breasts are like tall lotus buds,

analyzed: kuryāt go romantha ja phena lava śakṛt khura kṣata aupacite  acira prasūta huṅkṛta valgita vatsa utsave goṣṭhe  atha vā samudra tīre kuśala āgata ratna pota kpota ratna sambādhe
translated: One should perform in a cow pen where the cows are busy chewing the cud, and the calves are playing and lowing,🔽And the cows are recently delivered,🔽Or on the shore of the ocean, crowded with precious stones from a skillfully arrived treasure ship,

analyzed: ghana nicula līna jalacara sita khaga śabalīkṛta aupānte
translated: Where the water birds are hidden in the thick reeds, and the sound of the birds is sweet.

original: kṣamayā krodha iva jitaḥ siṃho mṛgyaabhibhūyate yeṣuK /yatra/🔽dattaabhayakhagamṛgaśāvakeṣu teṣv āśrameṣv atha vā//
analyzed: kṣamayā krodhaḥ iva jitaḥ siṃhaḥ mṛgya abhibhūyate yeṣukī atra  datta abhaya khaga mṛga śāvakeṣu teṣu āśrameṣu atha vā
translated: In which the lion is conquered by forgiveness, as if by anger, and overpowers the deer.🔽In those hermitages where the young birds and deer are fearless, or

analyzed: kāñcī kalāpa nūpura guru jaghana audvahana vighnita padābhiḥ
translated: In houses where the beautiful-eyed women, their feet impeded by the weight of their girdles, anklets, and hips,

original: śrīmati mṛgekṣaṇābhir gṛhe anyabhṛtavalguvacanābhiḥ//🔽puṇyeṣv āyataneṣu ca tīrtheṣuudyānaramyadeśeṣu/
analyzed: śrīmati mṛga īkṣaṇābhiḥ gṛhe anya bhṛta valgu vacanābhiḥ  puṇyeṣu āyataneṣu ca tīrtheṣu udyāna ramya deśeṣu
translated: Speak sweetly to their lovers, with words charming to others.🔽In holy temples, sacred fords, and delightful gardens,

analyzed: pūrva udak plava bhūmau pradakṣiṇa ambhaḥ vahāyām ca  bhasma aṅgāra asthi ūṣara tuṣa keśa śvabhra karkaṭa āvāsaiḥ
translated: On land sloping to the east or north, and on land where the water flows towards the south.🔽Where there are no dwellings of ashes, charcoal, bones, saline soil, chaff, hair, holes, or crabs,

analyzed: śvāvidhak śvāvidh mūṣaka vivaraiḥ valmīkaiḥ yā ca santyaktā
translated: And where there are no holes of porcupines, hedgehogs, mice, or ant-hills.

original: dhātrī ghanā sugandhā snigdhā madhurā samā ca vijayāya/
analyzed: dhātrī ghanā sugandhā snigdhā madhurā samā ca vijayāya
translated: A mother, dense, fragrant, unctuous, sweet, and even, is for victory.

analyzed: senā vāse api evam yojayitavyāḥ yathāyogam
translated: In a military camp, this should be applied as appropriate.

analyzed: niṣkramya purāt naktam daivajña amātya yājakāḥ prācyām
translated: Having gone out of the city at night, the astrologer, minister, and priest should offer oblations

original: kauberyāṃ vā kṛtvā baliṃ diśīśādhipāyāṃ vā//
analyzed: kauberyām vā kṛtvā balim diśi īśa adhipāyām vā
translated: To the east, north, or in the direction of the lord of the quarter.

analyzed: lājā akṣata dadhi kusumaiḥ prayataḥ praṇataḥ purohitaḥ kuryāt
translated: The priest, pure and humble, should offer parched grain, unbroken rice, and flowers.

original: āvāhanam atha mantras tasmin munibhiḥ samuddiṣṭaḥ//
analyzed: āvāhanam atha mantraḥ tasmin munibhiḥ samuddiṣṭaḥ
translated: The invocation and the mantra for that have been prescribed by the sages.

original: āgacchantu surāḥ sarve ye atra pūjāabhilāṣiṇaḥ/
analyzed: āgacchantu surāḥ sarve ye atra pūjā abhilāṣiṇaḥ
translated: Let all the gods come who are desirous of worship here.

original: diśo nāgā dvijāś caeva ye caapy anyeK /cāney apy aṃśabhāginaḥ//
analyzed: diśaḥ nāgāḥ dvijāḥ ca eva ye ca api api aṃśa bhāginaḥ
translated: The Nagas, Brahmins, and others who are entitled to a share in the offerings from the different directions.

original: āvāhyaevam tataḥ sarvān evaṃ brūyāt purohitaḥ/
analyzed: āvāhya evam tatas sarvān evam brūyāt purohitaḥ
translated: Having invoked all of them in this way, the priest should say thus:

original: śvaḥ pūjāṃ prāpya yāsyanti dattvā śāntiṃ mahīpateḥ//
analyzed: śvas pūjām prāpya yāsyanti dattvā śāntim mahīpateḥ
translated: Having received the worship tomorrow, they will leave after bestowing peace upon the king.

original: āvāhiteṣu kṛtvā pūjāṃ tāṃ śarvarīṃ vaseyus te/
analyzed: āvāhiteṣu kṛtvā pūjām tām śarvarīm vaseyuḥ te
translated: Having performed the worship of those invoked, they should spend the night there.

analyzed: sat asat svapna nimittam yātrāyām svapna vidhiḥ uktaḥ
translated: The omens seen in dreams, good or bad, are mentioned in the section on dreams in the chapter on expeditions.

original: apare ahani prabhāte sambhārān upahared yathoktaguṇān/
analyzed: apare ahani prabhāte sambhārān upaharet yathā ukta guṇān
translated: On the following day at dawn, he should collect the requisites with the qualities mentioned.

original: gatvā avanipradeśe ślokāś caapy atra munigītāḥ//
analyzed: gatvā avani pradeśe ślokāḥ ca api atra muni gītāḥ
translated: Having gone to a level piece of ground, and the verses sung by the sages in this regard,

original: tasmin maṇḍalam ālikhya kalpayet tatra medinīm/
analyzed: tasmin maṇḍalam ālikhya kalpayet tatra medinīm
translated: having drawn a circle there, he should imagine the earth there,

original: nānāratnākaravatīṃ sthānāni vividhāni ca//🔽purohito yathāsthānaṃ nāgān yakṣān surān pitṝn/
analyzed: nānā ratna ākaravatīm sthānāni vividhāni ca  purohitaḥ yathāsthānam nāgān yakṣān surān pitṝn
translated: endowed with various jewels and mines, and various places.🔽The priest should place the Nagas, Yakshas, gods, ancestors,

original: gandharvaapsarasaś caeva munīn siddhāṃś ca vinyaset//
analyzed: gandharva apsarasaḥ ca eva munīn siddhān ca vinyaset
translated: Gandharvas, Apsaras, sages, and Siddhas in their respective places.

original: grahāṃś ca sarvaK /sahanakṣatrai rudrāṃś ca saha mātṛbhiḥ/
analyzed: grahān ca rudrān ca saha mātṛbhiḥ
translated: And all the planets with the lunar mansions, and the Rudras with the Mothers,

original: skandaṃ viṣṇuṃ viśākhaṃ ca lokapālān surastriyaḥ//
analyzed: skandam viṣṇum viśākham ca lokapālān sura striyaḥ
translated: Skanda, Vishnu, and Vishakha, the Lokapalas, and the celestial women,

analyzed: varṇakaiḥ vivikdhaiḥ kṛtvā hṛdyaiḥ gandha guṇa anvitaiḥ
translated: Having made them with various pleasing colors endowed with the qualities of fragrance,

original: yathāsvaṃ pūjayed vidvān gandhamālyānulepanaiḥ//🔽bhakṣyair annaiś ca vividhaiḥ phalamūlaāmiṣais tathā/
analyzed: yathāsvam pūjayet vidvān gandha mālya anulepanaiḥ  bhakṣyaiḥ annaiḥ ca vividhaiḥ phala mūla āmiṣaiḥ tathā
translated: The wise one should worship them according to their own nature with incense, garlands, and unguents.🔽With various edibles, cooked rice, fruits, roots, and meat,

analyzed: pānaiḥ cakpānakaiḥ vividhaiḥ hṛdyaiḥ surā kṣīra āsava ādibhiḥ
translated: And with various pleasing drinks, such as wine, milk, and fermented liquors,

original: kathayāmy ataḥ param ahaṃ pūjām asmin yathābhilikhitānām/
analyzed: kathayāmi atas param aham pūjām asmin yathā abhilikhitānām
translated: From here onwards I shall describe the worship of those depicted here.

original: grahayajñe yaḥ prokto vidhir grahāṇāṃ sa kartavyaḥ//🔽māṃsaodanamadyaiḥ piśācadititanayadānavāḥ pūjyāḥ/
analyzed: graha yajñe yaḥ proktaḥ vidhiḥ grahāṇām sa kartavyaḥ  māṃsa odana madyaiḥ piśāca dititanaya dānavāḥ pūjyāḥ
translated: The procedure for the planets mentioned in the Grahayajna should be performed.🔽The Pishachas, Ditis, Tanayas, and Danavas should be worshipped with meat, cooked rice, and wine.

analyzed: abhyañjana añjana tilaiḥ pitaraḥ māṃsa odanaiḥ ca api
translated: The ancestors should be worshipped with unction, collyrium, sesamum seeds, and also with meat and cooked rice.

original: sāmayajurbhir munayas tv ṛgbhir gandhaiś ca dhūpamālyayutaiḥ/
analyzed: sāma yajurbhiḥ munayaḥ tu ṛgbhiḥ gandhaiḥ ca dhūpa mālya yutaiḥ
translated: The sages should be worshipped with the Sama and Yajur Vedas, the Rg Veda, and with fragrances, incense, and garlands.
The Nagas should be worshipped with the colors of the Aslesha constellation and with the three sweet things.

analyzed: dhūpa ājya āhuti mālyaiḥ vibudhān stuti praṇāmaiḥ ca
translated: The gods with incense, ghee offerings, and garlands; the gems with gems, and with praises and salutations.

original: gandharvān apsaraso gandhair mālyaiś ca susugandhaiḥ//
analyzed: gandharvān apsarasaḥ gandhaiḥ mālyaiḥ ca su sugandhaiḥ
translated: The Gandharvas and Apsaras with perfumes and very fragrant garlands.

original: śeṣāṃs tu sārvavarṇikabalibhiḥ pūjāṃ nyasec ca sarveṣām/
analyzed: śeṣān tu sārvavarṇika balibhiḥ pūjām nyaset ca sarveṣām
translated: But the rest with offerings common to all castes, and one should make offerings to all.

analyzed: pratisara vastra patākā bhūṣaṇa yajñopavītāni
translated: The protective cords, garments, banners, ornaments, and sacred threads.

original: maṇḍalapaścimabhāge kṛtvāagniṃ dakṣiṇe atha vā vedyām/
analyzed: maṇḍala paścima bhāge kṛtvā agnim dakṣiṇe atha vā vedyām
translated: Having made the fire to the west of the mandala, or on the altar to the south,

original: ādadyāt sambhārān darbhān dīrghān agarbhāṃś ca//🔽lājāājyaakṣatadadhimadhusiddhārthakagandhasumanaso dhūpaḥK /dhupān/
analyzed: ādadyāt sambhārān darbhān dīrghān a garbhān ca  lāja ājya akṣata dadhi madhu siddhārthaka gandha sumanasaḥ dhūpaḥ
translated: One should take the requisites - long, unsplit darbha grass.🔽Fried grain, ghee, unbroken rice, curd, honey, white mustard seeds, perfumes, flowers, incense,

original: gorocanaañjanatilāḥK /tilān svartujamadhurāṇi ca phalāni//🔽saghṛtasya pāyasasya ca tatra śarāvāṇi taiś ca sambhāraiḥ/
analyzed: gorocanā añjana tilāḥ tilān svar tuja madhurāṇi ca phalāni  sa ghṛtasya pāyasasya ca tatra śarāvāṇi taiḥ ca sambhāraiḥ
translated: Gorochana, collyrium, sesame seeds, and fruits that are naturally sweet in their season.🔽And there, on the western altar, one should make an offering of milk pudding with ghee, and with those requisites.

original: paścimavedyāṃ pūjāṃ kuryāt snānasyaU /snātasya sā vedī//🔽tasyāḥ koṇeṣu dṛḍhān kalaśān sitasūtraveṣṭitagrīvān/
analyzed: paścima vedyām pūjām kuryāt snānasya ausnātasya sā vedī  tasyāḥ koṇeṣu dṛḍhān kalaśān sita sūtra veṣṭita grīvān
translated: That altar is for the bathing of the one who has bathed.🔽In the corners of that altar, one should place firm water pots with their necks wrapped in white thread,

analyzed: sa kṣīravṛkṣa pallava phala apidhānān vyavasthāpya
translated: Covered with the leaves, fruits, and sprouts of trees that yield milky sap.

analyzed: puṣya snāna vimiśreṇa āpūrṇān ambhasā sa ratnān ca
translated: And filled with water mixed with the Pushya bath, and with jewels.

analyzed: puṣya snāna dravyāṇi ādadyāt garga gītāni
translated: One should take the articles for the Pushya bath, as sung by Garga.

analyzed: jyotiṣmatīm trāyamāṇām abhayām aparājitām
translated: The Jyotishmati, Trayamana, Abhaya, Aparajita,

original: jīvāṃ viśveśvarīṃ pāṭhāṃ samaṅgāṃ vijayāṃ tathā//
analyzed: jīvām viśveśvarīm pāṭhām samaṅgām vijayām tathā
translated: Jiva, Vishveshvari, Patha, Samanga, and Vijaya,

original: sahāṃ ca sahadevīṃ ca pūrṇakośāṃ śatāvarīm/
analyzed: sahām ca sahadevīm ca pūrṇa kośām śatāvarīm
translated: And Saha and Sahadevi, Purna-kosa, Shatavari,

original: ariṣṭikāṃ śivāṃ bhadrāṃ teṣu kumbheṣu vinyaset//
analyzed: ariṣṭikām śivām bhadrām teṣu kumbheṣu vinyaset
translated: Arishtika, Shiva, and Bhadra - these one should place in those pots.

original: brāhmīṃ kṣemām ajāṃ caeva sarvabījāni kāñcanīmK /kāñcanam/
analyzed: brāhmīm kṣemām ajām ca eva sarva bījāni kāñcanīm kkāñcanam
translated: Brahmi, Kshema, Aja, and all the golden seeds,

original: maṅgalyāni yathālābhaṃ sarvauṣadhyo rasāsK /rasāṃs tathā//🔽ratnāni sarvagandhāśK /sarvagandhāṃś ca bilvaṃ ca savikaṅkatam/
analyzed: maṅgalyāni yathālābham sarva oṣadhyaḥ rasāskrasān tathā  ratnāni ca bilvam ca sa vikaṅkatam
translated: Auspicious things as available, all herbs, and juices,🔽Jewels, all fragrances, and Bilva with Vikankata,

analyzed: praśasta nāmnyaḥ ca oṣadhyaḥ hiraṇyam maṅgalāni ca
translated: And herbs with auspicious names, gold, and auspicious things.

analyzed: ādau anaḍuhaḥ carma jarayā saṃhṛta āyuṣaḥ
translated: At the beginning, one should spread out the skin of an ox, whose life has been shortened by old age,

analyzed: praśasta lakṣaṇa bhṛtaḥ prācīna grīvam āstaret
translated: Bearing auspicious marks, with the neck towards the east.

original: tato vṛṣasya yodhasya carma rohitam akṣatam/
analyzed: tatas vṛṣasya yodhasya carma rohitam akṣatam
translated: Then the skin of a bull, a warrior, a red deer, uninjured,

original: simhasyātha tṛtīyaṃ syād vyāghrasya ca tataḥ param//
analyzed: simhasya atha tṛtīyam syāt vyāghrasya ca tatas param
translated: The third should be of a lion, and after that of a tiger.

original: catvāry etāni carmāṇi tasyāṃ vedyām upāstaret/
analyzed: catvāri etāni carmāṇi tasyām vedyām upāstaret
translated: He should spread out those four skins on that sacrificial altar.

analyzed: śubhe muhūrte samprāpte puṣya yukte niśākare
translated: When an auspicious moment has arrived, with the moon in conjunction with the Pushya constellation,

analyzed: bhadrāsanam ekatamena kāritam kanaka rajata tāmrāṇām
translated: A throne made of one of gold, silver, or copper,

analyzed: kṣīrataru nirmitam vā vinyasyam carmaṇām upari
translated: Or made of milkwood trees, should be placed on top of the skins.

original: trividhas tasyaucchrāyo hastaḥ pādādhiko ardhayuktaś ca/🔽māṇḍalikāanantarajitsamastarājyaarthināṃ śubhadaḥ//
analyzed: trividhaḥ tasya aucchrāyaḥ hastaḥ pāda adhikaḥ ardha yuktaḥ ca
